name: Wall push up
written_instructions:
1. Stand facing a wall at arm’s length, feet hip-width apart.
2. Place your palms flat on the wall at shoulder height, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
3. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, core engaged.
4. Bend your elbows slightly outward (not fully to the sides) and lower your chest toward the wall.
5. Press through your palms to return to the starting position, then repeat for desired reps.
audio_script: Face the wall and place your hands at shoulder height, a little wider than your shoulders. Step back slightly and keep your body straight. Bend your elbows and bring your chest toward the wall, then press away. Keep your core tight.

name: Kneeling push up
written_instructions:
1. Start on all fours with your hands flat on the floor, slightly wider than shoulder-width
2. Walk your hands forward and shift your weight so your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Keep your core engaged and your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
4. Lower your chest toward the floor in a controlled motion.
5. Press through your palms to return to the starting position, then repeat for desired reps.
audio_script: Start on all fours with your hands a little wider than your shoulders. Walk your hands forward and keep your body in a straight line from head to knees. Engage your core, bend your elbows, and lower your chest toward the floor. Push back up to the start and repeat.

name: Push up
written_instructions:
1. Start in a high plank position with your hands flat on the floor, slightly wider than shoulder-width, and your body in a straight line from head to heels.
2. Engage your core and keep your neck neutral.
3. Bend your elbows at a slight angle (not fully to the sides) and lower your chest toward the floor in a controlled motion.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your form consistent.
audio_script: Start in a high plank with your hands a little wider than your shoulders and your body straight from head to heels. Keep your core tight and your neck neutral. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the floor, then press back up to the start. Repeat with control.

name: Close grip push up
written_instructions:
1. Start in a high plank position with your hands placed directly under your shoulders or slightly closer together.
2. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, core engaged.
3. Bend your elbows close to your body as you lower your chest toward the floor in a controlled motion.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining elbows close throughout.
audio_script: Start in a high plank with your hands under your shoulders or slightly closer together. Keep your body straight and core engaged. Lower your chest by bending your elbows close to your sides, then press back up to the start. Keep your elbows tucked in as you repeat.

name: Loop band push up
written_instructions:
1. Place a loop resistance band around your upper back and secure the ends under your palms on the floor.
2. Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width and your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Engage your core and keep your neck neutral.
4. Bend your elbows at a slight angle (not fully to the sides) and lower your chest toward the floor in a controlled motion.
5. Press through your palms against the band’s resistance to return to the starting position, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Place a loop band across your upper back and pin the ends under your palms. Get into a high plank with your hands wider than your shoulders and body straight. Keep your core tight, lower your chest toward the floor, then press back up against the band’s resistance. Repeat.

name: Deficit push up
written_instructions:
1. Place two sturdy, equal-height platforms (such as weight plates or push-up handles) slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Start in a high plank position with each hand on a platform, body in a straight line from head to heels, and core engaged.
3. Bend your elbows at a slight angle (not fully to the sides) and lower your chest between the platforms in a controlled motion for a deeper range of motion.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining full control throughout.
audio_script: Place your hands on two sturdy platforms, slightly wider than shoulder-width. Start in a high plank with your body straight and core engaged. Lower your chest between the platforms for a deeper range of motion, then press back up to the start. Repeat with control.

name: Dumbbell pullover
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor and a dumbbell held with both hands above your chest.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and engage your core.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbell in an arc over and behind your head until you feel a stretch in your chest and lats.
4. Pull the dumbbell back over your chest by engaging your chest and back muscles.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining control of the weight throughout.
audio_script: Lie on a flat bench with your feet on the floor, holding a dumbbell above your chest. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and your core engaged. Lower the dumbbell back in an arc over your head until you feel a stretch, then pull it back above your chest. Repeat with control.

name: Band pullover
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a resistance band with handles to a sturdy point behind your head while lying on the floor (e.g., the base of a heavy piece of equipment).
2. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and arms extended straight overhead holding the handles.
3. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and engage your core.
4. Pull the handles in an arc until your arms are directly above your chest, squeezing your chest and lats.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position overhead in a controlled motion, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie on your back with your knees bent and a resistance band anchored behind you. Hold the handles overhead with your arms straight and a slight bend in the elbows. Keep your core tight, pull the handles forward in an arc until they’re above your chest, then slowly return overhead. Repeat.

name: Handle band pullover
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a resistance band with handles to a sturdy point behind your head while lying on the floor (e.g., the base of a heavy piece of equipment or a door anchor).
2. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and arms extended straight overhead holding the handles.
3. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and engage your core.
4. Pull the handles in an arc until your arms are directly above your chest, squeezing your chest and lats.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position overhead in a controlled motion, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie on your back with your knees bent and a resistance band anchored behind you. Hold the handles overhead with your arms straight and a slight bend in the elbows. Keep your core tight, pull the handles forward in an arc until they’re above your chest, then slowly return overhead. Repeat.

name: Machine dips
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the dip machine and adjust the seat height so the handles are level with your lower chest or slightly below.
2. Grasp the handles with a firm grip and position your feet flat on the floor or on the provided footrests.
3. Lean your torso slightly forward while keeping your shoulders down and elbows pointing back.
4. Press the handles downward by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straightened.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position in a controlled motion, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit on the dip machine with the handles at lower chest level. Grip the handles and place your feet on the floor or footrests. Lean forward slightly, keeping your shoulders down. Press the handles down until your arms are straight, then return slowly to the start. Repeat.

name: Assisted dips
written_instructions:
1. Step onto the assisted dip machine platform and select the desired assistance weight. More weight provides more support.
2. Grasp the parallel bars with your palms facing inward and arms straight, then place your knees (or feet, depending on machine design) on the assistance pad.
3. Lean your torso slightly forward while keeping your shoulders down and elbows pointing back.
4. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
5. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script:
Step onto the assisted dip machine and set the weight for support. Hold the bars with your arms straight and place your knees or feet on the pad. Lean forward slightly, lower until your arms are about parallel to the floor, then press back up to the start. Repeat.

3. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
4. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining control throughout the movement.

name: Weighted dips
written_instructions:

name: Barbell floor press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, holding a barbell with both hands above your chest.
2. Position your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width and keep your wrists straight.
3. Lower the barbell in a controlled motion until your upper arms touch the floor, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
4. Press the barbell upward until your arms are fully extended over your chest.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining control of the weight throughout.
audio_script: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, holding a barbell above your chest. Lower the bar until your upper arms touch the floor, keeping your elbows at a slight angle. Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended. Repeat.

name: Close-grip barbell floor press
written_instructions:

3. Lower the barbell in a controlled motion until your upper arms touch the floor, keeping your elbows close to your torso.

name: Dumbbell floor press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing forward.
2. Keep your wrists straight and your elbows slightly angled (not flared fully to the sides).
3. Lower the dumbbells in a controlled motion until your upper arms touch the floor.

name: Barbell bench press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor and your eyes directly under the barbell.
2. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width, keeping your wrists straight.
3. Unrack the bar and hold it above your chest with arms fully extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to touch the middle of your chest, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended over your chest, then repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: Barbell larsen press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your legs extended straight out and feet hovering off the floor.
2. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width and unrack it, holding it above your chest with arms fully extended.
3. Keep your core tight and lower back pressed into the bench to maintain stability.

name: Incline barbell bench press
written_instructions:
1. Set an adjustable bench to a 30–45° incline and lie back with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width, keeping your wrists straight.
3. Unrack the bar and hold it above your upper chest with arms fully extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to touch your upper chest, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: Decline barbell bench press
written_instructions:
1. Set a decline bench to the desired angle and secure your feet under the footpads.
2. Lie back on the bench with your eyes under the bar and grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.

5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: Dumbbell squeeze press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest.
2. Press the dumbbells together so they stay in contact throughout the movement, palms facing each other.
3. Lower the dumbbells in a controlled motion to your chest while maintaining constant inward pressure.
4. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended, keeping the dumbbells squeezed together.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining steady pressure throughout the exercise.

name: Cable flyes
written_instructions:
1. Set the pulleys on a cable machine to chest height and attach D-handles.
2. Stand in the middle, grab the handles, and take a small step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with your arms extended out to the sides, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing each other.
4. Bring the handles together in front of your chest in a wide arc, squeezing your chest at the midpoint.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position in a controlled motion, then repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: Banded chest flyes
variations: Single loop band low-to-high cable flyes
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each loop band and anchor both bands to sturdy points behind you at chest height, set wider than shoulder width so the bands stay clear of your arms.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with your arms extended out to the sides, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing each other.
4. Pull the handles together in a wide arc until they meet in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles at the midpoint.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.

4. Pull one handle upward and inward in an arc toward your upper chest while keeping the opposite arm extended at hip level.
5. Slowly return the working arm to the starting position, then repeat the movement with the opposite arm.
6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Attach a single-grip handle to each loop band and anchor both bands low and behind you, spaced wide enough so they stay clear of your arms. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance. Start with your arms slightly behind you at hip level, elbows bent, and palms facing forward or diagonally inward. Pull one handle upward and inward in an arc toward your upper chest while keeping the opposite arm extended at hip level. Slowly return the working arm to the starting position, then switch sides. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of reps.

name: Single loop band low-to-high cable flyes
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to one loop band and anchor the band low and behind you at a sturdy point.
2. Grab the handle with one hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with your working arm slightly behind you at hip level, elbow slightly bent, and palm facing forward/diagonally inward.
4. Pull the handle upward and inward in an arc toward your upper chest, squeezing your chest muscles at the top.
5. Slowly return your arm to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Anchor a loop band low and behind you, then attach a single-grip handle. Grab the handle with one hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance. Start with your working arm slightly behind you at hip level, elbow bent, and palm facing forward or diagonally inward. Pull the handle upward and inward in an arc toward your upper chest, squeezing your chest at the top. Slowly return your arm to the starting position, then repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.

name: Handle band low-to-high cable flyes
written_instructions:
1. Anchor the handled resistance band low and behind you at a sturdy point.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with your arms slightly behind you at hip level, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing forward/diagonally inward.
4. Pull the handles upward and inward in an arc toward your upper chest, squeezing your chest muscles at the top.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor a handled resistance band low and behind you at a sturdy point. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance. Start with your arms slightly behind you at hip level, elbows bent, and palms facing forward or diagonally inward. Pull the handles upward and inward in an arc toward your upper chest, squeezing your chest at the top. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.

name: Handle band chest flyes
written_instructions:
1. Anchor the handled resistance band to a sturdy point behind you at chest height.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with your arms extended out to the sides, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing each other.
4. Pull the handles together in a wide arc until they meet in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles at the midpoint.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position in a controlled motion, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor a handled resistance band to a sturdy point behind you at chest height. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance. Start with your arms extended out to the sides, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing each other. Pull the handles together in a wide arc until they meet in front of your chest, squeezing your chest at the midpoint. Slowly return your arms to the starting position in control, then repeat for the desired reps.

name: Banded floor press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Loop one resistance band across your upper back and hold each end in your hands.
2. Position your hands at chest level as if holding a barbell or dumbbells, keeping your elbows bent and resting lightly on the floor.
3. Press your hands upward against the band’s resistance until your arms are fully extended over your chest.
4. Slowly lower your arms back down until your upper arms touch the floor.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping tension on the band throughout.
audio_script: Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Loop a resistance band across your upper back and hold each end in your hands. Position your hands at chest level with elbows bent and resting lightly on the floor. Press your hands upward against the band’s resistance until your arms are fully extended over your chest. Slowly lower your arms back down until your upper arms touch the floor, then repeat for the desired reps, keeping tension on the band throughout.

name: Handle band floor press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, holding one handle in each hand.
2. Position the band across your upper back, just below shoulder level, with the handles pulled alongside your chest.
3. Start with your elbows bent and upper arms resting lightly on the floor.
4. Press the handles upward against the band’s resistance until your arms are fully extended over your chest.
5. Slowly lower your arms back down until your upper arms touch the floor, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, holding one handle in each hand. Position the band across your upper back, just below shoulder level, with the handles alongside your chest. Start with your elbows bent and upper arms resting lightly on the floor. Press the handles upward against the band’s resistance until your arms are fully extended over your chest. Slowly lower your arms back down until your upper arms touch the floor, then repeat for the desired reps.

name: Band bench press
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a resistance band under a flat bench and attach single-grip handles to each end.
2. Lie back on the bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding one handle in each hand at chest level.
3. Start with your elbows bent and wrists straight.
4. Press the handles upward against the band’s resistance until your arms are fully extended over your chest.
5. Slowly lower the handles back down to chest level, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor a band under the bench and hold a handle in each hand at chest level. Lie back with your feet flat on the floor. Press the handles upward until your arms are straight, then lower them back down to chest level with control. Repeat.

name: Handle band bench press
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a handled resistance band securely under a flat bench.
2. Lie back on the bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding one handle in each hand at chest level.
3. Start with your elbows bent and wrists straight.
4. Press the handles upward against the band’s resistance until your arms are fully extended over your chest.
5. Slowly lower the handles back down to chest level, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor the band under the bench and hold a handle in each hand at chest level. Lie back with your feet flat on the floor. Press the handles upward until your arms are straight, then lower them back down to chest level with control. Repeat.

name: Close grip low-to-high cable press
written_instructions:
1. Set the pulleys on a cable machine to the lowest setting and attach D-handles.
2. Stand in the middle, grab the handles, and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with the handles held close to your chest, elbows bent and tucked slightly in.
4. Press the handles upward and inward in a straight arc until your arms are extended above chest height, keeping the handles close together.
5. Slowly return the handles back to chest level in control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Set the cables low and hold the handles close to your chest. Step forward into a staggered stance. Press the handles upward and inward until your arms are extended above chest height, keeping them close together. Return with control to your chest, then press again.

name: Close grip low-to-high band press
variations: Close grip low-to-high double band press
Close grip high-to-low double band press
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of a loop band and anchor the band low and behind you at a sturdy point.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with the handles held close to your chest, elbows bent and tucked slightly in.
4. Press the handles upward and inward in a straight arc until your arms are extended above chest height, keeping the handles close together.
5. Slowly return the handles back to chest level in control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor a loop band low behind you with a handle in each hand. Step forward into a staggered stance and hold the handles close to your chest. Press them upward and inward until your arms are extended above chest height, keeping them close together. Return with control to your chest, then repeat.

name: Close grip low-to-high double band press
variations: Close grip high-to-low double band press
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each loop band and anchor both bands low and behind you, spaced wide enough to stay clear of your arms.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with the handles held close to your chest, elbows bent and tucked slightly in.
4. Press the handles upward and inward in a straight arc until your arms are extended above chest height, keeping the handles close together.
5. Slowly return the handles back to chest level in control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor two loop bands low behind you with a handle in each hand. Step forward into a staggered stance and hold the handles close to your chest. Press them upward and inward until your arms are extended above chest height, keeping them close together. Return with control to your chest, then repeat.

name: Close grip Handle band press
variations: Close grip high-to-low Handle band press
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a handled resistance band securely behind you at chest height.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with the handles close to your chest, elbows bent and tucked slightly in.
4. Press the handles straight forward until your arms are fully extended, keeping the handles close together.
5. Slowly bring the handles back to your chest in control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor a handled band behind you at chest height. Step forward into a staggered stance and hold the handles close to your chest. Press them forward until your arms are straight, keeping the handles close together. Return with control to your chest, then press again.

name: Close grip cable press
written_instructions:
1. Set the pulleys on a cable machine to chest height and attach D-handles.
2. Stand in the middle, grab the handles, and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Hold the handles close to your chest with elbows bent and tucked slightly in.
4. Press the handles straight forward until your arms are fully extended, keeping the handles close together.
5. Slowly bring the handles back to your chest in control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Set the cables to chest height and hold the handles close to your chest. Step forward into a staggered stance. Press the handles straight forward until your arms are extended, keeping them close together. Return with control to your chest, then press again.

name: Close grip band press
variations: Close grip low-to-high double band press
Close grip high-to-low double band press
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and anchor the band securely behind you at chest height.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with the handles close to your chest, elbows bent and tucked slightly in.
4. Press the handles straight forward until your arms are fully extended, keeping the handles close together.
5. Slowly bring the handles back to your chest in control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor a loop band behind you at chest height with a handle in each hand. Step forward into a staggered stance and hold the handles close to your chest. Press them straight forward until your arms are extended, keeping them close together. Return with control to your chest, then press again.

name: Close grip double band press
variations: Close grip low-to-high double band press
Close grip high-to-low double band press
progression: Close grip low-to-high double band press
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each loop band and anchor both bands securely behind you at chest height, spaced wide enough to stay clear of your arms.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with the handles close to your chest, elbows bent and tucked slightly in.
4. Press the handles straight forward until your arms are fully extended, keeping the handles close together.
5. Slowly bring the handles back to your chest in control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor two loop bands behind you at chest height with a handle in each hand. Step forward into a staggered stance and hold the handles close to your chest. Press them straight forward until your arms are extended, keeping the handles close together. Return with control to your chest, then press again.

name: Close grip Handle band press
variations: Close grip high-to-low Handle band press
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a handled resistance band securely behind you at chest height.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Keep the handles close to your chest with elbows bent and tucked slightly in.
4. Press the handles straight forward until your arms are fully extended, keeping them close together.
5. Slowly bring the handles back to your chest in control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor a handled band behind you at chest height. Step forward into a staggered stance and hold the handles close to your chest. Press them straight forward until your arms are extended, keeping them close together. Return with control to your chest, then press again.

name: Close grip high-to-low cable press
written_instructions:
1. Set the pulleys on a cable machine to the highest setting and attach D-handles.
2. Stand in the middle, grab the handles, and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Hold the handles close to your chest with elbows bent and tucked slightly in.
4. Press the handles downward and inward in a straight arc until your arms are extended in front of your lower chest or upper abdomen, keeping the handles close together.
5. Slowly return the handles to chest level in control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Set the cables high and hold the handles close to your chest. Step forward into a staggered stance. Press the handles downward and inward until your arms are extended in front of your lower chest. Return with control to your chest, then press again.

name: Close grip high-to-low band press
variations: Close grip low-to-high double band press
Close grip high-to-low double band press
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and anchor the band securely high and behind you at a sturdy point.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Keep the handles close to your chest with elbows bent and tucked slightly in.
4. Press the handles downward and inward in a straight arc until your arms are extended in front of your lower chest or upper abdomen, keeping the handles close together.
5. Slowly return the handles to chest level in control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor a loop band high behind you and hold a handle in each hand. Step forward into a staggered stance and keep the handles close to your chest. Press them downward and inward until your arms are extended in front of your lower chest. Return with control to your chest, then press again.

name: Close grip high-to-low double band press
variations: Close grip low-to-high double band press
progression: Close grip low-to-high double band press
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each loop band and anchor both bands securely high and behind you, spaced wide enough to stay clear of your arms.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Keep the handles close to your chest with elbows bent and tucked slightly in.
4. Press the handles downward and inward in a straight arc until your arms are extended in front of your lower chest or upper abdomen, keeping the handles close together.
5. Slowly return the handles to chest level in control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor two loop bands high behind you with a handle in each hand. Step forward into a staggered stance and keep the handles close to your chest. Press them downward and inward until your arms are extended in front of your lower chest. Return with control to your chest, then press again.

name: Close grip high-to-low Handle band press
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a handled resistance band securely high and behind you at a sturdy point.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Keep the handles close to your chest with elbows bent and tucked slightly in.
4. Press the handles downward and inward in a straight arc until your arms are extended in front of your lower chest or upper abdomen, keeping the handles close together.
5. Slowly return the handles to chest level in control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Anchor a handled band high behind you and hold a handle in each hand. Step forward into a staggered stance and keep the handles close to your chest. Press them downward and inward until your arms are extended in front of your lower chest. Return with control to your chest, then press again.

name: Cable crossover
written_instructions:
1. Set the pulleys on a cable machine to chest or shoulder height and attach D-handles.
2. Stand in the middle, grab the handles with palms facing down, and step forward into a staggered stance.
3. Start with your arms out to the sides, elbows bent.
4. Pull the handles forward and across your body until your hands cross in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles.
5. Slowly return to the starting position in control, then alternate which hand crosses on the next rep.
audio_script: Set the pulleys to chest height and grab the handles with palms facing down. Step forward into a staggered stance with your arms out to the sides and elbows slightly more bent than in a fly. Pull the handles forward and cross them in front of your chest. Squeeze your chest, then return slowly and repeat, alternating the crossover.

name: Bent-forward cable crossover
written_instructions:
1. Set the pulleys on a cable machine to the highest setting and attach D-handles.
2. Stand in the middle, grab the handles with palms facing down, and step forward into a staggered stance.
3. Hinge your torso slightly forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
4. Start with your arms out to the sides and elbows bent.
5. Pull the handles downward and across your body until your hands cross in front of your lower chest or upper abdomen, squeezing your chest muscles.
6. Slowly return to the starting position in control, then alternate which hand crosses on the next rep.
audio_script: Set the pulleys high and grab the handles with palms facing down. Step forward and hinge slightly at the hips. With elbows bent, pull the handles downward and across your body until your hands cross in front of your lower chest. Squeeze your chest, then return slowly and repeat, alternating the crossover.

name: Band crossover
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each loop band and anchor both bands securely behind you at chest height, spaced wide enough to stay clear of your arms.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with your arms out to the sides, elbows more bent than in a fly, and palms facing down.
4. Pull the handles forward and across your body until your hands cross in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position in control, then alternate which hand crosses on the next rep.
audio_script: Anchor two loop bands behind you at chest height and hold a handle in each hand. Step forward into a staggered stance with your arms out to the sides, elbows bent, and palms down. Pull the handles forward and cross them in front of your chest. Squeeze your chest, then return slowly and repeat, alternating the crossover.

name: Bent-forward band crossover
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each loop band and anchor both bands securely high and behind you, spaced wide enough to stay clear of your arms.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance.
3. Hinge your torso slightly forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
4. Start with your arms out to the sides, elbows bent, and palms facing down.
5. Pull the handles downward and across your body until your hands cross in front of your lower chest or upper abdomen, squeezing your chest.
6. Slowly return to the starting position in control, then alternate which hand crosses on the next rep.
audio_script: Anchor two loop bands high behind you and hold a handle in each hand. Step forward and hinge slightly at the hips. With elbows bent and palms down, pull the handles downward and across until your hands cross in front of your lower chest. Squeeze your chest, then return slowly and repeat, alternating the crossover.

name: Resistance band bar press
written_instructions:
1. Clip one end of a loop band to a carabiner on the bar.
2. Pass the band through a sturdy anchor point behind you at chest height, then clip the other end to the opposite carabiner on the bar.
3. Stand facing away from the anchor in a staggered stance, gripping the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
4. Hold the bar at chest level with elbows bent.
5. Press the bar straight forward against the band’s resistance until your arms are fully extended.
6. Slowly bring the bar back to chest level under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Attach a loop band to the bar by clipping one end, threading it through a chest-height anchor behind you, and clipping the other end to the bar. Stand facing away in a staggered stance, holding the bar at chest level. Press the bar straight forward until your arms are extended, then return slowly to your chest. Repeat.

name: Chest fly machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the chest fly machine and adjust the seat height so the handles are level with the middle of your chest.
2. Place your feet flat on the floor and press your back firmly against the pad.
3. Grasp the handles with your palms facing forward or inward, elbows slightly bent.
4. Bring the handles together in a wide arc in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles at the midpoint.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control, keeping the slight bend in your elbows throughout. Repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the chest fly machine with the handles at chest level. Keep your feet flat and back against the pad. With elbows slightly bent, bring the handles together in front of your chest and squeeze. Return slowly to the start, keeping that bend in your elbows, and repeat.

name: TRX Chest Press
written_instructions:
1. Adjust the TRX straps to mid-length and stand facing away from the anchor point, holding one handle in each hand.
2. Step forward to create tension in the straps, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Position your feet either together or in a staggered stance for balance.
4. Bend your elbows at a slight angle and lower your chest toward your hands in a controlled motion.
5. Press through the handles to straighten your arms and return to the starting position, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hold the TRX handles and face away from the anchor. Step forward to create tension and keep your body straight from head to heels. Lower your chest by bending your elbows, then press back to the start. Repeat.

name: Smith machine bench press
variations: Close-grip incline smith machine bench press
written_instructions:
1. Position a flat bench under the Smith machine bar and lie on your back with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width and unrack it by rotating the bar hooks.
3. Start with the bar held above your chest, arms extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion until it lightly touches the middle of your chest, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie on a flat bench under the Smith bar with your feet on the floor. Grip the bar wider than shoulder-width and unrack it. Lower the bar in control to your chest, then press it back up until your arms are straight. Repeat.

name: Close-grip smith machine bench press
variations: Close-grip incline smith machine bench press
written_instructions:
1. Position a flat bench under the Smith machine bar and lie on your back with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Grip the bar about shoulder-width apart or slightly closer, and unrack it by rotating the bar hooks.
3. Start with the bar held above your chest, arms extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to your mid chest, keeping your elbows close to your torso.
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie on a flat bench under the Smith bar with your feet on the floor. Grip the bar about shoulder-width or slightly closer and unrack it. Lower the bar to your mid chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. Press it back up until your arms are straight, then repeat.

name: Incline smith machine bench press
variations: Close-grip incline smith machine bench press
progression: Close-grip incline smith machine bench press
written_instructions:
1. Set an adjustable bench to a 30–45° incline and position it under the Smith machine bar.
2. Lie back with your feet flat on the floor and grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
3. Unrack the bar by rotating the hooks and hold it above your upper chest with arms extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to lightly touch your upper chest, keeping your elbows at a slight angle.
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Set a bench to a 30 to 45 degree incline under the Smith bar. Lie back with your feet on the floor and grip the bar wider than shoulder-width. Unrack it and hold it above your upper chest. Lower the bar in control to your chest, then press back up until your arms are straight. Repeat.

name: Close-grip incline smith machine bench press
written_instructions:
1. Set an adjustable bench to a 30–45° incline and position it under the Smith machine bar.
2. Lie back with your feet flat on the floor and grip the bar about shoulder-width apart or slightly closer.
3. Unrack the bar by rotating the hooks and hold it above your upper chest with arms extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to your upper chest, keeping your elbows close to your torso.
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Set a bench to a 30 to 45 degree incline under the Smith bar. Lie back with your feet on the floor and grip the bar shoulder-width or closer. Unrack it and hold it above your upper chest. Lower the bar to your chest, keeping elbows close, then press back up until your arms are straight. Repeat.

name: Flat chest press machine
written_instructions:
1. Lie flat on the chest press machine bench and adjust the seat so the handles line up with the middle of your chest.
2. Place your feet flat on the floor or foot platform for stability.
3. Grip the handles with your palms facing forward and elbows bent at about 90°.
4. Press the handles upward until your arms are fully extended without locking your elbows.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position in control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie flat on the chest press machine with the handles at chest level. Keep your feet planted for support. Grip the handles with palms forward and elbows bent. Press the handles upward until your arms are extended, then lower slowly back to the start. Repeat.

name: Incline chest press machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit or lie back on the incline chest press machine so the handles are level with your upper chest.
2. Place your feet flat on the floor or foot platform for stability and press your back firmly against the pad.
3. Grip the handles with your palms facing forward and elbows bent at about 90°.
4. Press the handles upward until your arms are fully extended without locking your elbows.
5. Slowly lower the handles back down under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the incline chest press machine with the handles at upper chest level. Keep your feet planted and back against the pad. Grip the handles with elbows bent. Press the handles upward until your arms are extended, then lower slowly to the start. Repeat.

name: Seated chest press machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the chest press machine with your back firmly against the pad and feet flat on the floor.
2. Adjust the seat height so the handles are level with the middle of your chest.
3. Grip the handles with palms facing forward and elbows bent at about 90°.
4. Press the handles straight forward until your arms are fully extended without locking your elbows.
5. Slowly return the handles back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the chest press machine with your back against the pad and feet flat. Adjust the seat so the handles are at chest level. Grip the handles with elbows bent. Press them straight forward until your arms are extended, then return slowly to the start. Repeat.

name: Seated cable pec fly
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the cable pec fly machine with your back against the pad and feet flat on the floor.
2. Adjust the seat height so the handles are level with the middle of your chest.
3. Grip the handles with your palms facing each other, arms out to the sides and elbows slightly bent.
4. Pull the handles together in a wide arc until they meet in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles at the midpoint.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the cable pec fly machine with your back against the pad and feet flat. Adjust the seat so the handles line up with your chest. With elbows slightly bent, bring the handles together in front of your chest and squeeze. Return slowly to the start and repeat.

name: Floor dumbbell fly
written_instructions:
1. Lie flat on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other and elbows slightly bent.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until your upper arms lightly touch the floor.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together above your chest, maintaining the slight bend in your elbows.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, keeping the motion slow and controlled.
audio_script: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your chest, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms touch the floor, then bring them back together above your chest. Repeat with control.

name: Dumbbell fly
written_instructions:
1. Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other and elbows slightly bent.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until they are at chest level or slightly below, keeping the slight bend in your elbows.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together above your chest in the same wide arc, squeezing your chest muscles at the top.
5. Repeat for the desired reps with slow, controlled motion.
audio_script: Lie on a flat bench with your feet on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your chest, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells out wide to chest level, then bring them back together above your chest and squeeze. Repeat with control.

name: Incline dumbbell fly
written_instructions:
1. Set a bench to a 30–45° incline and lie back with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your upper chest with palms facing each other and elbows slightly bent.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until they are level with your chest or shoulders, keeping the slight bend in your elbows.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together above your upper chest in the same wide arc, squeezing your chest muscles at the top.
5. Repeat for the desired reps with slow, controlled motion.
audio_script: Lie on an incline bench with your feet on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your upper chest, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells out wide to chest level, then bring them back together above your chest and squeeze. Repeat with control.

name: Cambered bar bench press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor and a cambered bar racked above you.
2. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width and unrack it, holding it above your chest with arms extended.
3. Lower the bar in a controlled motion into the cambered section, allowing for a deeper stretch at the bottom.
4. Keep your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie on a flat bench with your feet on the floor and grip the cambered bar wider than shoulder-width. Unrack it and hold it above your chest. Lower the bar into the cambered section for a deeper stretch, then press it back up until your arms are straight. Repeat.

name: Incline cambered bar bench press
written_instructions:
1. Set an adjustable bench to a 30–45° incline and position it under a cambered bar in the rack.
2. Lie back with your feet flat on the floor and grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
3. Unrack the bar and hold it above your upper chest with arms extended.
4. Lower the bar into the cambered section in a controlled motion until you feel a deep stretch across your chest, keeping elbows at a slight angle.
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Set a bench to a 30 to 45 degree incline under a cambered bar. Lie back with your feet flat and grip the bar wider than shoulder-width. Unrack it and hold it above your upper chest. Lower the bar into the cambered section for a deeper stretch, then press back up until your arms are straight. Repeat.

name: Banded single arm saw
variations: Single loop band low-to-high cable flyes
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a resistance band at chest height to a sturdy point.
2. Stand sideways to the anchor in a staggered stance, holding the handle with the arm closest to the anchor.
3. Pull the handle across the front of your body in a straight line, finishing with your arm extended in front of the opposite side of your chest.
4. Slowly return the band to the starting position under control.
5. Complete the desired reps on one side, then switch and repeat with the other arm.
audio_script: Stand sideways to the anchor with the band at chest height. Hold the handle in the hand closest to the anchor. Pull the band straight across the front of your body until your arm is extended in front of your chest, then return slowly. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

name: Standing dumbbell lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and your core engaged.
3. Raise both dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, keeping palms facing downward and elbows leading the movement.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to your sides under control.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, avoiding swinging or shrugging your shoulders.
audio_script: Stand with feet hip-width apart and dumbbells at your sides. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise the dumbbells out to shoulder height with palms down. Lower slowly to your sides and repeat.

name: Banded lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward band lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of a loop band and place the middle of the band under one foot in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward, elbows slightly bent, and core engaged.
3. Raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, leading with your elbows and keeping palms facing downward.
4. Slowly lower the handles back to your sides under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your torso still and avoiding swinging.
audio_script: Stand in a staggered stance with one foot on the band and a handle in each hand at your sides. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise the handles out to shoulder height with palms down. Lower slowly to your sides and repeat.

name: Handle band lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward Handle band lateral raise
bent over Handle band lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand in the middle of a handled resistance band with your feet hip-width apart or in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward, elbows slightly bent, and core braced.
3. Raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, leading with your elbows and keeping palms facing downward.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to your sides under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your torso still and avoiding swinging or shrugging.
audio_script: Stand on the middle of a handled band with a handle in each hand at your sides. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise the handles out to shoulder height with palms down. Lower slowly to your sides and repeat.

name: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing inward.
2. Hinge forward slightly at the hips so your torso leans forward while keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. With elbows slightly bent, raise both dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down under control.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, avoiding swinging or shrugging your shoulders.
audio_script: Stand with dumbbells at your sides and hinge slightly forward at the hips. With elbows bent, raise the dumbbells out to shoulder height, then lower them slowly. Repeat.

name: Standing leaning forward band lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and place the middle of the band under one foot in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward and hinge slightly forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. With elbows slightly bent, raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or shrugging.
audio_script: Stand in a staggered stance with the band under one foot and a handle in each hand. Hinge forward at the hips. With elbows bent, raise the handles out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Standing leaning forward Handle band lateral raise
variations: bent over Handle band lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand on the middle of a handled resistance band with your feet hip-width apart or in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward and hinge slightly forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. With elbows slightly bent, raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or shrugging.
audio_script: Stand on the middle of a handled band with a handle in each hand. Hinge forward at the hips and keep your back straight. With elbows bent, raise the handles out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Bent over dumbbell lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at arm’s length with palms facing each other.
2. Hinge forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. Let the dumbbells hang below your shoulders with elbows slightly bent.
4. Raise both dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, squeezing your rear delts at the top.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hinge forward at the hips until your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing each other. With elbows slightly bent, raise the dumbbells out to shoulder height, then lower them slowly. Repeat.

name: Bent over band lateral raise
prerequisite_exercise: Standing leaning forward band lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward band lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and place the middle of the band under one foot in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other and hinge forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
3. Let the handles hang below your shoulders with elbows slightly bent.
4. Raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, squeezing your rear delts at the top.
5. Slowly lower the handles back down under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand in a staggered stance with the band under one foot and hinge forward until your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other. With elbows bent, raise the handles out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Bent over Handle band lateral raise
prerequisite_exercise: Standing leaning forward Handle band lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward Handle band lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand on the middle of a handled resistance band with your feet hip-width apart or in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other and hinge forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. Let the handles hang below your shoulders with elbows slightly bent.
4. Raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, squeezing your rear delts at the top.
5. Slowly lower the handles back down under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand on the middle of a handled band and hinge forward until your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other. With elbows bent, raise the handles out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Standing full ROM lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise the dumbbells out to the sides in an arc, continuing past shoulder height until they meet overhead.
3. At the top, your arms should be almost straight with the backs of your palms facing each other.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells along the same path back to your sides under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or leaning back.
audio_script: Stand with dumbbells at your sides and a slight bend in your elbows. Raise them out to the sides and keep going until the dumbbells meet overhead, with the backs of your palms facing each other. Lower slowly to your sides and repeat.

name: Lean-in dumbbell lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand beside a sturdy support (rack, cable post, or wall) and hold it with your non-working hand.
2. Hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand at your side with palm facing inward, then lean your torso slightly toward the support.
3. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell out to the side until it reaches shoulder height or overhead.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to your side under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one arm, then switch sides.
audio_script: Stand beside a support and hold it with one hand. Lean your torso slightly toward the support while holding a dumbbell at your side. With a bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell to shoulder height or overhead, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

name: Lean-away dumbbell lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand beside a sturdy support and hold it with your non-working hand.
2. Hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand at your side with palm facing inward, positioning your feet closer to the support so your torso leans away.
3. From this stretched position, raise the dumbbell out to the side until it reaches shoulder height or slightly higher.
4. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one arm, then switch sides.
audio_script: Stand beside a support and hold it with one hand. Lean your torso away from the support while holding a dumbbell at your side. With a bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

name: Cable lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a single-grip handle. Stand sideways to the machine with the working shoulder farthest from the pulley.
2. Grab the handle with the outside hand, palm facing inward, and keep a slight bend in your elbow.
3. Brace your core and keep your torso still as you raise your arm out to the side in a wide arc until it reaches shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handle back to your side under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one arm, then switch sides.
audio_script: Stand sideways to the cable with the pulley low. Hold the handle in the outside hand at your side. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise your arm out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

name: Leaning forward cable lateral raise
prerequisite_exercise: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
regression: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a single-grip handle. Stand sideways to the machine with the working shoulder farthest from the pulley.
2. Hold the handle with the outside hand, palm facing inward, and step slightly away from the machine.
3. Hinge forward at the hips so your torso leans toward the floor while keeping your back straight and core engaged.
4. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise your arm out to the side in a wide arc until it reaches shoulder height.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Set the pulley low and stand sideways to the machine. Hold the handle in the outside hand and hinge forward at the hips. With a bend in your elbow, raise your arm to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

name: Standing machine lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand inside the lateral raise machine and grasp the handles or bars attached to the lever arms with palms facing inward.
2. Keep your torso upright, core braced, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise the handles outward in a wide arc until your arms reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your shoulders.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand in the machine and hold the handles with palms in. With elbows slightly bent, raise the handles out to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Seated machine lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the lateral raise machine with your back against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Adjust the seat height so the pads rest comfortably against the outside of your upper arms just above the elbows.
2. Grip the handles lightly if available, keeping your torso upright and core braced.
3. Push your arms outward against the pads, raising them in a wide arc until they reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your shoulders.
5. Slowly return the arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the lateral raise machine with the pads against your upper arms. Keep your torso upright and push your arms out to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Barbell front raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep your torso upright, core braced, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise the barbell straight up in front of you until it reaches shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or leaning back.
audio_script: Stand tall with a barbell in front of your thighs, palms down. With elbows slightly bent, raise the bar to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Alternating dumbbell front raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body.
2. Keep your torso upright, core braced, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise one dumbbell straight up in front of you until it reaches shoulder height while keeping the other arm at your side.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position under control as you prepare to lift the opposite arm.
5. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand. Raise one dumbbell to shoulder height, then lower it as you lift the other. Keep your core tight and alternate reps.

name: Seated alternating dumbbell front raise
written_instructions:
1. Sit tall on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward toward your body.
2. Keep your back straight, core engaged, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise one dumbbell forward and upward to shoulder height while rotating your wrist so your palm faces downward at the top.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to your side under control as you prepare to lift the opposite arm.
5. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit tall with dumbbells at your sides, palms in. Raise one dumbbell forward to shoulder height while rotating your wrist so the palm faces down, then lower slowly. Alternate arms for reps.

name: Banded front raise
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and place the middle of the band under one foot in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body, elbows slightly bent, and core engaged.
3. Raise both handles straight forward and upward until they reach shoulder height, keeping arms straight but not locked.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or leaning back.
audio_script: Stand in a staggered stance with the band under one foot and a handle in each hand in front of your thighs. Raise both handles forward to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Handle band front raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand on the middle of a handled resistance band with your feet hip-width apart or in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body, elbows slightly bent, and core engaged.
3. Raise both handles straight forward and upward until they reach shoulder height, keeping arms straight but not locked.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or leaning back.
audio_script: Stand on the middle of a handled band with a handle in each hand in front of your thighs. Raise both handles forward to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Side lying dumbbell raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your side on a flat bench or the floor, holding a dumbbell in your top hand with your arm extended straight down toward the floor, palm facing your body.
2. Keep your lower arm relaxed along your torso and brace your core.
3. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell upward in an arc until your arm is vertical above your shoulder.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one side, then switch and perform on the other side.
audio_script: Lie on your side with a dumbbell in the top hand. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell upward until your arm is vertical, then lower slowly. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Lying lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Lie face down on a flat or incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms hanging straight down below your shoulders, palms facing each other.
2. Keep your chest supported on the bench, core engaged, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise both dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until they reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your rear delts.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie face down on a bench with dumbbells hanging below your shoulders. With elbows slightly bent, raise the dumbbells to shoulder height, squeeze, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Cable Y-raise
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a single-grip handle. Stand sideways to the machine with the working shoulder farthest from the pulley.
2. Hold the handle in the outside hand with palm facing inward, arm resting across the front of your body.
3. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise the handle upward and outward at about a 45° angle until your arm forms a “Y” shape with your torso.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your shoulder.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Stand sideways to the cable with the pulley low. Hold the handle in the outside hand and raise it upward and outward at a 45-degree angle into a Y-shape. Pause, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

name: Reverse pec deck
written_instructions:
1. Sit facing the pec deck machine with your chest against the pad, feet flat on the floor, and grasp the handles or place your forearms against the pads.
2. Start with your arms extended forward at shoulder height, elbows slightly bent.
3. Pull the handles or pads outward and backward in a wide arc until your arms are extended to your sides.
4. Pause briefly at the end of the movement, squeezing your rear delts and upper back.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit facing the pec deck with your chest on the pad. Grab the handles and pull your arms back in a wide arc until they’re out to your sides, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Standing barbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell at shoulder level with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of the bar.
3. Press the barbell upward in a slight arc, guiding it forward just enough to avoid your face.
4. At the top, lock out your arms with the barbell directly over the middle of your head.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with a barbell at shoulder height, palms forward. Brace your core and press the bar upward in a slight arc to avoid your face, finishing above the middle of your head. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Seated barbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Sit on a bench with an upright back support and place your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell at shoulder level with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of the bar.
3. Press the barbell upward in a slight arc, guiding it forward just enough to avoid your face.
4. At the top, lock out your arms with the barbell directly over the middle of your head.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit upright with a barbell at shoulder height, palms forward. Brace your core and press the bar upward in a slight arc to avoid your face, finishing above the middle of your head. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: L-sit barbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you in an “L” position, feet together and torso upright. Hold a barbell at shoulder level with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of the bar.
3. Press the barbell upward in a slight arc, guiding it forward just enough to avoid your face.
4. At the top, lock out your arms with the barbell directly above the middle of your head while keeping your torso tall.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the floor with legs straight in front of you and a barbell at shoulder height. Brace your core and press the bar upward in a slight arc to avoid your face, finishing above the middle of your head. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Standing band shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand on the bottom of a loop band with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the top of the band in each hand.
2. Bring your hands up to shoulder height with palms facing forward, elbows bent, and core braced.
3. Press the band upward in a slight arc until your arms are fully extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep your arms straight but not locked, with the band directly above your head.
5. Slowly lower your hands back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand on a loop band and hold the top in each hand at shoulder height. Press upward until your arms are extended overhead, then lower slowly. Repeat

name: Standing dumbbell shoulder press
variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
progression: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of your torso in a comfortable pressing position.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms forward. Press the dumbbells straight overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
variations: Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder height with your palm facing forward.
2. Place your free hand on your hip or keep it out for balance, brace your core, and keep your torso upright.
3. Press the dumbbell straight upward until your arm is extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbell above your head with your arm straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Stand tall with a dumbbell at shoulder height in one hand. Brace your core and press the dumbbell overhead until your arm is extended, then lower slowly. Repeat and switch sides.

name: Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
regression: Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows close to your sides in a comfortable pressing position.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing each other. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Seated dumbbell shoulder press
variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Sit upright on a bench with a back support, feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of your torso in a comfortable pressing position.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
