audio_script: Sit upright with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms forward. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
progression: Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Sit upright on a bench with a back support, feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows close to your sides in a comfortable pressing position.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit upright with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing each other. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: L-sit dumbbell shoulder press
variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
progression: L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you in an “L” position, feet together and torso upright. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of your torso.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the floor with your legs straight in front of you and dumbbells at shoulder height. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you in an “L” position, feet together and torso upright. Hold a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder height with your palm facing forward.
2. Place your free hand on your thigh or out to the side for balance, keeping your chest up and core braced.
3. Press the dumbbell straight upward until your arm is extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbell directly above your head with your arm straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Sit on the floor with your legs straight in front of you and a dumbbell at shoulder height in one hand. Press it overhead until your arm is extended, then lower slowly. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Seated shoulder press machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the machine with your back firmly against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Adjust the seat height so the handles are level with or just below your shoulders.
2. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, palms facing forward, and keep your elbows bent.
3. Brace your core and press the handles upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the handles directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to shoulder level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit with your back against the pad and grasp the handles at shoulder height. Press the handles overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell upright row
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders down, and core braced.
3. Pull the dumbbells upward along the front of your body by bending your elbows and leading with them, keeping the dumbbells close.
4. Raise the dumbbells until they reach chest level or slightly below shoulder height, keeping elbows higher than wrists.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with dumbbells in front of your thighs, palms in. Lead with your elbows as you pull the dumbbells up to chest level, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Rope upright row
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a rope handle. Stand tall facing the machine and grasp the rope with both hands, palms facing each other.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders down, and core braced with the rope resting lightly against your thighs.
3. Pull the rope upward along the front of your body by bending your elbows and leading with them, keeping the rope close.
4. Raise the rope until your hands reach chest level or slightly below shoulder height, keeping elbows higher than wrists.
5. Slowly lower the rope back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a low cable with a rope attachment. Hold the rope with palms facing each other and pull upward to chest level, leading with your elbows. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Reverse cable crossover
written_instructions:
1. Set both pulleys on a cable machine to the highest setting. Stand in the middle of the machine with your feet staggered for balance.
2. Grab the end of the left cable with your right hand and the end of the right cable with your left hand so the cables cross in front of you. Extend your arms forward at shoulder height with a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Pull the cables outward and backward in a wide arc until your arms are extended straight out to your sides.
4. Pause briefly at the end of the movement, squeezing your rear delts and upper back.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand between two high pulleys and grab the cable ends so they cross in front of you. With elbows slightly bent, pull the cables out and back until your arms are to your sides, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Standing banded high row
variations: Standing rope face pulls with band
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and anchor the band to a sturdy point at shoulder height.
2. Stand facing the anchor in a staggered stance for balance and grasp a handle in each hand, arms extended forward at shoulder height.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest up, and pull the handles back and outward by driving your elbows high and wide.
4. Squeeze your upper back and rear delts at the end of the movement.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand in a staggered stance facing the anchor with the band set at shoulder height. Hold a handle in each hand and pull your elbows back and out wide until your hands reach your upper chest, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Handle band high row
variations: Standing rope face pulls with band
written_instructions:
1. Anchor the handled resistance band to a sturdy point at shoulder height.
2. Stand facing the anchor in a staggered stance and grasp a handle in each hand with arms extended forward at shoulder height.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and pull the handles back and outward by driving your elbows high and wide.
4. Squeeze your upper back and rear delts at the end of the movement.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand in a staggered stance facing the anchor with the band set at shoulder height. Hold the handles and pull your elbows back and wide until your hands reach your upper chest, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Half kneeling banded high row
variations: ['Standing banded high row', 'Handle band high row', ''Standing rope face pulls with band']
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and anchor the band to a sturdy point at shoulder height.
2. Get into a half-kneeling stance facing the anchor, with one knee on the ground and the other foot planted forward for stability.
3. Hold a handle in each hand with arms extended forward at shoulder height, chest tall, and core braced.
4. Pull the handles back and outward by driving your elbows high and wide until your hands are near your upper chest.
5. Squeeze your upper back and rear delts, then slowly return to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Kneel on one knee facing the anchor with the band at shoulder height. Hold the handles with arms forward. Pull your elbows back and wide until your hands reach your upper chest, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Standing rope face pulls
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to about upper-chest or face height and attach a rope handle.
2. Stand facing the machine in a staggered stance, holding the rope with both hands, palms facing each other.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and start with your arms extended forward.
4. Pull the rope toward your face by driving your elbows back and flaring them outward, separating the rope as it nears your face.
5. Squeeze your rear delts and upper back, then slowly return your arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley with a rope attachment. Hold the rope with palms facing each other and pull it toward your face, separating the ends as your elbows flare out. Squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Standing rope face pulls with band
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a loop band to a sturdy point at about face height and attach a triceps rope to the band.
2. Stand facing the anchor in a staggered stance for balance and hold one end of the rope in each hand with palms facing each other.
3. Start with your arms extended forward, chest tall, and core braced.
4. Pull the rope toward your face by driving your elbows back and outward, separating the rope ends as they approach your face.
5. Squeeze your rear delts and upper back, then slowly return your arms to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Anchor a loop band with a rope at face height. Stand facing it and hold the rope with palms facing each other. Pull the rope toward your face, separating the ends as your elbows flare out. Squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell squat to shoulder press
variations: Double kettlebell squat to shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
2. Brace your core, push your hips back, and lower into a squat until your thighs are about parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels to stand up, using the upward momentum to begin pressing the dumbbells overhead.
4. At the top, extend your arms fully with the dumbbells directly above your head, then lower them back to shoulder height.
5. Flow smoothly into the next squat and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing each other. Squat down, then drive up and press the dumbbells overhead in one motion. Lower them back to your shoulders and repeat.

name: Kettlebell squat to shoulder press
variations: Double kettlebell squat to shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the round body of the kettlebell with both hands at chest level. Place your thumbs where the handle meets the bell for support, palms facing each other.
2. Brace your core, push your hips back, and lower into a squat until your thighs are about parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels to stand up, using the upward momentum to begin pressing the kettlebell overhead with both hands.
4. At the top, extend your arms fully with the kettlebell directly above your head, then lower it back to chest level.
5. Flow smoothly into the next squat and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hold the round part of the kettlebell with both hands at chest level, thumbs under the handle. Squat down, then drive up and press the kettlebell overhead. Lower it back to your chest and repeat.

name: Double kettlebell squat to shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand in the racked position at shoulder height with palms facing inward and elbows tucked slightly in front of your body.
2. Brace your core, push your hips back, and lower into a squat until your thighs are about parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels to stand up, using the upward momentum to begin pressing both kettlebells overhead.
4. At the top, extend your arms fully with the kettlebells directly above your head, then lower them back to the racked position at your shoulders.
5. Flow smoothly into the next squat and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hold two kettlebells in the racked position at your shoulders. Squat down, then drive up and press both kettlebells overhead. Lower them back to your shoulders and repeat.

name: Squat to band shoulder press
variations: Double kettlebell squat to shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand on the middle of a loop band with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the top of the band in both hands at shoulder height, palms facing forward.
2. Brace your core, push your hips back, and lower into a squat until your thighs are about parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels to stand up, using the upward momentum to press the band overhead.
4. At the top, extend your arms fully with the band directly above your head, then lower your hands back to shoulder height.
5. Flow smoothly into the next squat and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand on a loop band and hold it at shoulder height. Squat down, then drive up and press the band overhead. Lower back to your shoulders and repeat.

name: Standing smith machine shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Set the bar on a Smith machine to about upper-chest level and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart under the bar.
2. Grip the bar with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, palms facing forward, and unrack it to shoulder height.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and press the bar upward along the guided track until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the bar directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand under the Smith bar and unrack it at shoulder height. Press it overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Seated smith machine shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Place a bench with a back support under the Smith machine bar and adjust the bar to about upper-chest level.
2. Sit on the bench with your feet flat on the floor, grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width with palms facing forward, and unrack it to shoulder height.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and press the bar upward along the guided track until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the bar directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on a bench under the Smith bar and unrack it at shoulder height. Press the bar overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: L-sit smith machine shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Position the Smith machine bar at about upper-chest level. Sit on the floor under the bar with your legs extended straight in front of you in an “L” position, torso upright.
2. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width with palms facing forward and unrack it to shoulder height.
3. Brace your core and keep your back tall against the bar path.
4. Press the bar upward along the guided track until your arms are extended overhead, keeping it aligned above the middle of your head.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the floor under the Smith bar with your legs straight in front of you. Unrack the bar at shoulder height and press it overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the round body of a kettlebell with both hands at chest level. Place your thumbs where the handle meets the bell for support, palms facing each other.
2. Brace your core and keep your chest upright.
3. Press the kettlebell overhead in a smooth motion until your arms are extended.
4. At the top, keep the kettlebell directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the kettlebell back to chest level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hold the round part of the kettlebell with both hands at chest level, thumbs under the handle. Press it overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Double kettlebell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand in the racked position at shoulder height, palms facing inward and the bells resting against your forearms.
2. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and position your elbows slightly in front of your torso.
3. Press both kettlebells overhead in a smooth motion, allowing your palms to rotate forward naturally as you press.
4. At the top, keep the kettlebells directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the kettlebells back to the racked position at shoulder height and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hold two kettlebells in the racked position at shoulder height. Brace your core and press them overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Upside down kettlebell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell upside down in one hand so the round bell is above the handle. Keep it at shoulder height with your palm facing inward and wrist straight.
2. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and stabilize the kettlebell in the bottoms-up position.
3. Press the kettlebell slowly overhead, keeping it balanced directly above your wrist.
4. At the top, extend your arm fully with the kettlebell directly above your head, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the kettlebell back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Hold a kettlebell upside down at shoulder height, palm in. Brace your core and press it slowly overhead while keeping it balanced, then lower with control. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: EZ curl bar skull crushers
variations: EZ curl bar floor skull crushers
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding an EZ curl bar with a close overhand grip. Position the bar above your chest with arms extended.
2. Keep your upper arms fixed and elbows pointing upward throughout the movement.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar toward your forehead in a controlled motion.
4. Stop just short of touching your forehead, then press the bar back up by extending your elbows.
5. Fully straighten your arms at the top, avoiding elbow lockout, and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie on a bench holding an EZ curl bar above your chest. Bend your elbows to lower the bar toward your forehead, then extend your arms to press it back up. Repeat.

name: EZ curl bar floor skull crushers
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, holding an EZ curl bar with a close overhand grip. Position the bar above your chest with arms extended.
2. Keep your upper arms fixed and elbows pointing upward throughout the movement.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar toward your forehead in a controlled motion.
4. Allow your upper arms to lightly touch the floor as a natural stopping point.
5. Press the bar back up by extending your elbows until your arms are straight, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie on the floor holding an EZ curl bar above your chest. Lower the bar toward your forehead until your arms touch the floor, then press it back up. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell skull crushers
variations: EZ curl bar floor skull crushers
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other.
2. Keep your upper arms fixed and elbows pointing upward throughout the movement.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the dumbbells toward the sides of your head in a controlled motion.
4. Stop just short of touching your head, then extend your elbows to press the dumbbells back up.
5. Fully straighten your arms at the top, avoiding forceful lockout, and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie on a bench holding dumbbells above your chest, palms facing each other. Bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells toward your head, then extend your arms to press them back up. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell floor skull crushers
variations: EZ curl bar floor skull crushers
regression: EZ curl bar floor skull crushers
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other.
2. Keep your upper arms fixed and elbows pointing upward throughout the movement.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the dumbbells toward the sides of your head in a controlled motion.
4. Allow your upper arms to lightly touch the floor as a natural stopping point.
5. Extend your elbows to press the dumbbells back up until your arms are straight, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie on the floor holding dumbbells above your chest, palms facing each other. Lower them toward your head until your arms touch the floor, then extend back up. Repeat.

name: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
variations: Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
regression: Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ curl bar with a close overhand grip. Press the bar overhead until your arms are fully extended.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and core braced.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then press the bar back up by extending your elbows.
5. Fully extend your arms overhead without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with an EZ curl bar held overhead. Lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows, then press it back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Standing plate overhead triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight plate with both hands at the sides or gripping the handles if available. Press the plate overhead until your arms are fully extended.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and core braced.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the plate behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the plate back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall holding a weight plate overhead. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbows, then press it back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Standing overhead kettlebell triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the round body of a kettlebell with both hands, thumbs placed where the bell meets the handle. Press it overhead until your arms are fully extended.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and brace your core.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the kettlebell behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the kettlebell back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hold the round part of the kettlebell with both hands and press it overhead. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbows, then press it back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Standing dumbbell overhead triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Press both dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended, palms facing each other.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and core braced.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the dumbbells behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the dumbbells back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall holding two dumbbells overhead, palms facing each other. Lower them behind your head by bending your elbows, then press them back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
regression: Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand and pressing it overhead until your arm is fully extended.
2. Keep your upper arm close to your head, elbow pointing forward, and core braced.
3. Bend your elbow to slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbow to press the dumbbell back overhead.
5. Complete the desired reps on one arm, then switch sides.
audio_script: Stand tall with a dumbbell held overhead in one hand. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbow, then press it back up until your arm is extended. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension

written_instructions:
1. Sit upright on a bench with back support, feet flat on the floor, holding an EZ curl bar with a close overhand grip. Press the bar overhead until your arms are fully extended.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and core braced against the bench.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the bar back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on a bench holding an EZ curl bar overhead. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbows, then press it back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:

2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and brace your core against the bench.

4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the plate back overhead.

audio_script: Sit on a bench holding a weight plate overhead. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbows, then press it back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Seated overhead kettlebell triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:

2. Press the kettlebell overhead until your arms are fully extended.
3. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and brace your core against the bench.
4. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the kettlebell behind your head in a controlled arc.
5. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the kettlebell back overhead. Repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on a bench holding the round part of a kettlebell with both hands. Press it overhead, then lower it behind your head by bending your elbows. Extend back up and repeat.

name: Seated dumbbell overhead triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:

2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and brace your core against the bench.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the dumbbells behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the dumbbells back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on a bench holding two dumbbells overhead, palms facing each other. Lower them behind your head by bending your elbows, then press them back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension

written_instructions:

2. Keep your upper arm close to your head, elbow pointing forward, and brace your core against the bench.
3. Bend your elbow to slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbow to press the dumbbell back overhead.
5. Complete the desired reps on one arm, then switch sides.
audio_script: Sit on a bench holding a dumbbell overhead in one hand. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbow, then press it back up until your arm is extended. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Assisted close grip dips
written_instructions:
1. Step onto the assisted dip machine platform and select the desired assistance weight. More weight provides more support.
2. Grasp the dip bars with your hands placed close together, directly under your shoulders.
3. Place your knees (or feet, depending on the machine design) on the assistance pad and press yourself up to the starting position with arms straight.
4. Lean your torso slightly forward, keep your shoulders down, and bend your elbows close to your body as you lower until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
5. Press through your hands to return to the starting position, maintaining elbows close throughout, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Step onto the assisted dip machine and grip the bars close together. Lower your body with elbows tight to your sides, then press back up to straight arms. Repeat.

name: Close grip dips
written_instructions:
1. Grasp parallel dip bars with your hands placed close together, directly under your shoulders, and press yourself up to the starting position with arms straight.
2. Cross your ankles behind you or keep your legs straight, lean your torso slightly forward, and keep your shoulders down.
3. Bend your elbows close to your torso and lower your body in a controlled motion until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
4. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, keeping elbows close throughout the movement.
audio_script: Grip the dip bars close together and press up to straight arms. Lower your body with elbows tight to your sides, then press back up. Repeat.

name: Weighted close grip dips
written_instructions:
1. Secure a dip belt around your waist and attach a weight plate or dumbbell so it hangs between your legs.
2. Grasp parallel dip bars with your hands placed close together, directly under your shoulders, and press yourself up to the starting position with arms straight.
3. Cross your ankles behind you or keep your legs straight, lean your torso slightly forward, and keep your shoulders down.
4. Bend your elbows close to your torso and lower your body in a controlled motion until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
5. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Secure a dip belt with weight and grip the bars close together. Lower your body with elbows tight to your sides, then press back up to straight arms. Repeat.

name: Bench dips
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the edge of a sturdy bench with your hands placed next to your hips, fingers pointing forward.
2. Walk your feet forward and extend your legs, keeping your heels on the floor and arms straight to support your weight.
3. Lower your body by bending your elbows straight back until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your body back up.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, keeping your shoulders down and movement controlled.
audio_script: Place your hands on the edge of a bench and extend your legs forward. Lower your body by bending your elbows, then press back up to straight arms. Repeat.

name: Standing dumbbell triceps kickbacks
variations: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
Static bird dog with triceps extension
regression: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
written_instructions:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your body and stand with your feet hip-width apart. Hinge forward slightly at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
2. Bend your elbows to bring the dumbbells to your sides so your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
3. Keeping your upper arms still, extend your elbows to press the dumbbells straight back until your arms are fully extended.
4. Squeeze your triceps briefly at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly bend your elbows to return the dumbbells to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hinge forward holding dumbbells with elbows bent at your sides. Extend your arms straight back, squeeze your triceps, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Chest supported triceps kickback
variations: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
Static bird dog with triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Set an incline bench to about 30–45° and lie chest-down with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body.
2. Let the dumbbells hang straight down, then bend your elbows to bring them to your sides so your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
3. Keeping your upper arms still, extend your elbows to press the dumbbells straight back until your arms are fully extended.
4. Squeeze your triceps briefly at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly bend your elbows to return the dumbbells to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie chest-down on an incline bench with dumbbells hanging down. Bend your elbows, then extend your arms straight back, squeeze your triceps, and return slowly. Repeat.

name: Cable triceps kickbacks
variations: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
Static bird dog with triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and stand facing the machine, holding the end of the cable directly in your hand (no attachment).
2. Step back and hinge slightly at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. Bend your elbow to bring your upper arm parallel to the floor, close to your torso.
4. Keeping your upper arm still, extend your elbow to press the cable straight back until your arm is fully extended.
5. Slowly bend your elbow to return to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Hold the end of a low cable and hinge forward slightly. With your elbow by your side, extend your arm straight back, squeeze your triceps, then return slowly. Repeat and switch sides.

name: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
variations: Static bird dog with triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Place your left hand and left knee on a flat bench for support, holding a dumbbell in your right hand with your palm facing your body.
2. Keep your back flat, core engaged, and let the dumbbell hang straight down from your shoulder.
3. Bend your right elbow to bring the dumbbell up so your upper arm is parallel to the floor and close to your torso.
4. Keeping your upper arm still, extend your elbow to press the dumbbell straight back until your arm is fully extended.
5. Slowly bend your elbow to return to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Place one hand and knee on a bench for support, holding a dumbbell in the other hand. Bring your elbow up, then extend your arm straight back, squeeze your triceps, and return slowly. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Static bird dog with triceps extension
variations: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
regression: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
written_instructions:
1. Begin on all fours in a tabletop position with your wrists under your shoulders and knees under your hips. Hold a light dumbbell in your right hand.
2. Extend your left leg straight back until it is parallel to the floor, keeping your core engaged and back flat.
3. Bend your right elbow to bring the dumbbell close to your torso, upper arm parallel to the floor.
4. Keeping your upper arm still, extend your elbow to press the dumbbell straight back until your arm is fully extended.
5. Slowly return the dumbbell to the starting position, maintaining balance throughout. Complete reps on one side, then switch arms and legs.
audio_script: Start on all fours holding a dumbbell in one hand. Extend the opposite leg straight back. With your elbow up, extend your arm straight back into a triceps kickback. Return slowly, keep balance, and repeat. Switch sides.

name: Seated tricep extension machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the triceps extension machine with your back against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Adjust the seat height so your elbows align with the machine’s pivot point.
2. Grip the handles with your palms facing downward or inward, depending on the machine design.
3. Keep your upper arms close to your head or supported against the pad, elbows bent to start.
4. Press the handles downward by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight.
5. Slowly allow the handles to return to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the machine with elbows aligned to the pivot. Grip the handles and press them down by extending your elbows, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Seated overhead tricep extension machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the machine with your back firmly against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Adjust the seat height so your elbows line up with the machine’s pivot point.
2. Grasp the handles positioned overhead with your palms facing inward.
3. Keep your upper arms close to your head and elbows bent to start, bracing your core.
4. Extend your elbows to press the handles upward in a smooth motion until your arms are fully straight.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position behind your head under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the machine with handles overhead. Keep your elbows close and extend your arms to press the handles up, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: V-bar triceps pushdown
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the highest setting and attach a V-bar handle. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grip the V-bar with both hands using a neutral grip (palms facing inward) and bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.
4. Press the V-bar down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, keeping elbows tucked in.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley with a V-bar. Keep your elbows close and press the bar down until your arms are straight, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: V-bar overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a V-bar handle. Stand facing away from the machine and grasp the V-bar with both hands using a neutral grip (palms facing inward). Step forward so the cable runs behind your head and press the bar overhead until your arms are extended.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and brace your core.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the V-bar behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the bar back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forceful lockout, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing away from a low cable with a V-bar. Hold it overhead with elbows close to your head. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbows, then press back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Curl bar triceps pushdown
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the highest setting and attach an EZ-curl bar. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grip the bar on the angled portions with palms facing slightly inward and bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.
4. Press the bar down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, keeping elbows tucked in.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley with an EZ-curl bar. Keep your elbows close and press the bar down until your arms are straight, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Curl bar overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach an EZ-curl bar. Stand facing away from the machine and grasp the bar on the angled portions with palms facing slightly inward. Step forward so the cable runs behind your head and press the bar overhead until your arms are extended.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and brace your core.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the bar back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forceful lockout, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing away from a low cable with an EZ-curl bar. Hold it overhead with elbows close to your head. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbows, then press back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Rope triceps pushdown
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the highest setting and attach a rope handle. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grab one end of the rope in each hand with palms facing each other and bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.
4. Press the rope down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, separating the rope ends at the bottom.
5. Slowly return the rope to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley with a rope. Keep your elbows close, press the rope down, and separate the ends at the bottom. Return slowly and repeat.

name: Banded rope triceps pushdown
variations: Underhand triceps pushdown with loop band
Overhand triceps pushdown with loop band
Horizontal triceps extension with loop band
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a loop resistance band to a sturdy point at about head height and attach a triceps rope to the band. Stand facing the anchor with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold one end of the rope in each hand with palms facing each other and bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.
4. Press the rope down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, separating the rope ends at the bottom.
5. Slowly return the rope to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Anchor a loop band with a rope at head height. Hold the rope with palms facing each other. Press it down, separating the ends at the bottom, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Rope overhead triceps pushdown
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a rope handle. Stand facing away from the machine, step forward so the cable runs behind your head, and hold one end of the rope in each hand with palms facing each other.
2. Bring the rope overhead so your elbows are bent and close to your head, core braced.
3. Extend your elbows to press the rope forward and upward until your arms are fully straight.
4. Separate the rope ends slightly at the end of the movement and squeeze your triceps.
5. Slowly return the rope to the starting position behind your head under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Face away from a low cable with a rope. Hold it overhead with elbows close to your head. Extend your arms forward and up, separating the rope ends slightly at the finish, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Banded rope overhead triceps pushdown
variations: Underhand triceps pushdown with loop band
Overhand triceps pushdown with loop band
Horizontal triceps extension with loop band
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a loop band to a low, sturdy point behind you and attach a triceps rope to the band. Stand facing away from the anchor so the band runs behind your head and hold one end of the rope in each hand with palms facing each other.
2. Step forward slightly and bring the rope overhead so your elbows are bent and close to your head, core braced.
3. Extend your elbows to press the rope forward and upward until your arms are fully straight.
4. Separate the rope ends slightly at the finish and squeeze your triceps.
5. Slowly return the rope to the starting position behind your head under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Anchor a loop band with a rope low behind you. Face away, bring the rope overhead with elbows close, extend your arms forward and up, separate the ends at the finish, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Straight bar underhand tricep pushdown
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the highest setting and attach a straight bar. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grasp the bar with an underhand (supinated) grip—palms facing up—hands about shoulder-width apart. Bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.
4. Press the bar down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, keeping your elbows tucked in.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley holding a straight bar palms up. Keep elbows close and press the bar down until your arms are straight, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: One-arm underhand triceps pushdown
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the highest setting and attach a single-grip handle. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grasp the handle with an underhand (supinated) grip—palm facing up—and bring your elbow close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbow bent at about 90 degrees, forearm pointing forward and down.
4. Press the handle down by extending your elbow until your arm is fully straight, keeping your elbow tucked in.
5. Slowly return the handle to the starting position under control, then complete the desired reps before switching arms.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley holding a single handle palm up. Keep your elbow close and press the handle down until your arm is straight, then return slowly. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Underhand triceps pushdown with loop band
variations: Overhand triceps pushdown with loop band
Horizontal triceps extension with loop band
regression: Overhand triceps pushdown with loop band
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and anchor the middle of the band to a sturdy point at about head height. Stand facing the anchor with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grasp a handle in each hand with an underhand (supinated) grip—palms facing up—and bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.
4. Press the handles down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, keeping your elbows tucked in.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Anchor one loop band with two handles at head height. Hold the handles palms up, elbows close, and press down until your arms are straight, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: One-arm overhand triceps pushdown
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the highest setting and attach a single-grip handle. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grasp the handle with an overhand (pronated) grip — palm facing down — and bring your elbow close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbow bent at about 90 degrees, forearm pointing forward and down.
4. Press the handle down by extending your elbow until your arm is fully straight, keeping your elbow tucked in.
5. Slowly return the handle to the starting position under control, then complete the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley holding a single handle palm down. Keep your elbow close and press the handle down until your arm is straight, then return slowly. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Overhand triceps pushdown with Handle band
variations: Underhand triceps pushdown with Handle band
Horizontal triceps extension with Handle band

written_instructions:
1. Anchor the handle band to a sturdy point at about head height. Stand facing the anchor with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with an overhand (pronated) grip — palms facing down — and bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and slightly down.
4. Press the handles down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, keeping elbows tucked in.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Anchor the handle band at head height. Hold a handle in each hand palms down, elbows close, and press down until your arms are straight, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Horizontal triceps extension with loop band
variations: Underhand triceps pushdown with loop band
Overhand triceps pushdown with loop band
regression: Overhand triceps pushdown with loop band
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of a loop band and anchor the middle at about chest height. Stand facing away from the anchor with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing away from your body (pronated grip), elbows bent at 90 degrees, and upper arms parallel to the floor. Bring the handles next to your ears.
3. Keep your elbows tucked in and stationary, maintaining the 90-degree angle between your upper arms and torso.
4. Extend your arms fully in front of you until straight, keeping control and tension in the triceps.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position next to your ears, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Anchor a loop band at chest height. Hold a handle in each hand palms away from you, elbows bent and upper arms parallel to the floor, handles next to your ears. Extend your arms fully in front, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Horizontal triceps extension with Handle band
variations: Underhand triceps pushdown with Handle band
Overhand triceps pushdown with Handle band
regression: Overhand triceps pushdown with Handle band
written_instructions:
1. Anchor the handle band to a sturdy point at about chest height. Stand facing away from the anchor with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing away from your body (pronated grip), elbows bent at 90 degrees, and upper arms parallel to the floor. Bring the handles next to your ears.
3. Keep your elbows tucked in and stationary, maintaining the 90-degree angle between your upper arms and torso.
4. Extend your arms fully in front of you until straight, keeping control and tension in the triceps.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position next to your ears, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Anchor the handle band at chest height. Hold a handle in each hand palms away from you, elbows bent and upper arms parallel to the floor, handles next to your ears. Extend your arms fully in front, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Diamond push up
written_instructions:
1. Start in a standard push-up position with your hands together under your chest, forming a diamond shape by touching your thumbs and index fingers.
2. Position your feet hip-width apart and keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Engage your core and glutes to maintain alignment throughout the movement.
4. Lower your chest toward your hands by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your torso.
5. Push back up to the starting position by straightening your arms, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Start in a push-up position with your hands forming a diamond under your chest. Keep your body straight, elbows close, and lower your chest toward your hands. Push back up slowly and repeat.

name: Assisted wide grip pull up
written_instructions:
1. Adjust the assisted pull-up machine to the desired assistance level. Selecting a heavier weight from the stack increases assistance, making the exercise easier. Kneel or stand on the foot platform as instructed.
2. Grip the pull-up bar with hands wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing away from you (pronated grip).
3. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
4. Pull your chest up toward the bar by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Set the assisted pull-up machine to your level — heavier stack weight gives more assistance and makes it easier. Grip the bar wider than shoulders, palms away. Pull your chest up, squeeze shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Banded wide grip pull up
written_instructions:
1. Secure a resistance band around a pull-up bar and place your knee or foot in the band to assist the movement.
2. Grip the bar with hands wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing away (pronated grip).
3. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
4. Pull your chest up toward the bar by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, using the band for assistance.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Place a resistance band around the pull-up bar and step or kneel in it for assistance. Grip the bar wide, palms away. Pull your chest up, squeezing your shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Wide grip pull up
written_instructions:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with hands wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing away from you (pronated grip).
2. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
3. Keep your body stable without swinging or kipping.
4. Pull your chest up toward the bar by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Grip the bar wide, palms away. Hang with shoulders engaged and core tight. Pull your chest up to the bar, squeeze shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Weighted wide grip pull up
written_instructions:
1. Secure additional weight using a dip belt, weighted vest, or hold a dumbbell between your feet.
2. Grip the pull-up bar with hands wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing away (pronated grip).
3. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
4. Pull your chest up toward the bar by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping the added weight controlled.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Add weight with a dip belt, vest, or dumbbell. Grip the bar wide, palms away. Hang with shoulders engaged and core tight. Pull your chest to the bar, then lower slowly under control. Repeat.

name: Assisted neutral grip pull up
written_instructions:
1. Adjust the assisted pull-up machine to the desired assistance level. Selecting a heavier weight increases assistance, making the exercise easier. Kneel or stand on the foot platform as instructed.
2. Grip the pull-up handles with palms facing each other (neutral grip).
3. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
4. Pull your chest toward the handles by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Set the assisted machine to your level — heavier stack weight gives more assistance. Grip the handles with palms facing each other. Pull your chest to the handles, squeezing shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Banded neutral grip pull up

3. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
4. Pull your chest toward the handles/bar by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, using the band for assistance.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Place a resistance band around the bar and step or kneel in it. Grip the bar with palms facing each other. Pull your chest toward the bar, squeezing shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Neutral grip pull up
written_instructions:
1. Grip the pull-up bar with palms facing each other (neutral grip) at roughly shoulder-width apart.
2. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
3. Keep your body stable without swinging or kipping.
4. Pull your chest toward the bar by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.

audio_script: Grip the bar with palms facing each other, shoulder-width apart. Hang with shoulders engaged and core tight. Pull your chest to the bar, squeeze your shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Weighted neutral grip pull up

written_instructions:
1. Sit at the lat pulldown machine and select the desired weight.
2. Grip a straight bar attachment with palms facing you (supinated grip), hands about shoulder-width apart.
3. Sit tall with chest up, shoulders back and down, and core engaged.
4. Pull the bar toward your upper chest by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows pointing down and back.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit at the machine and grip a straight bar with palms facing you, shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar to your upper chest, squeezing shoulder blades, then slowly release. Keep core tight and repeat.

name: Overhand close grip lat pull down
variations: Wide neutral grip lat pull down
Neutral close grip lat pull down
Underhand close grip lat pull down
written_instructions:
1. Sit at the lat pulldown machine and select the desired weight.
2. Grip a straight bar attachment with palms facing away from you (pronated grip), hands about shoulder-width apart.
3. Sit tall with chest up, shoulders back and down, and core engaged.
4. Pull the bar down toward your upper chest by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows pointing down and back.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit at the machine and grip a straight bar with palms facing away, shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar to your upper chest, squeezing shoulder blades, then slowly release. Keep core tight and repeat.

name: Half-kneeling overhand banded bar lat pulldown
variations: Half-kneeling underhand banded bar lat pulldown
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a loop band to a sturdy overhead point. Attach each end of the loop band to the carabiners at each end of the resistance band bar.
2. Kneel on one knee (half-kneeling) with the other foot in front for balance, facing the anchor.
3. Grip the bar with an overhand (palms down) grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
4. Pull the bar down toward your upper chest by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows pointed down and back, while maintaining a stable core and upright torso.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Kneel on one knee facing the anchor. Hold the bar with palms down, pulling it to your upper chest while squeezing shoulder blades. Release slowly, keeping your core stable, and repeat.

name: Half-kneeling underhand banded bar lat pulldown
variations: Half-kneeling overhand banded bar lat pulldown
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a loop band to a sturdy overhead point. Attach each end of the loop band to the carabiners at each end of the resistance band bar.
2. Kneel on one knee (half-kneeling) with the other foot in front for balance, facing the anchor.
3. Grip the bar with an underhand (palms facing you) grip, hands slightly closer than shoulder-width apart or at shoulder-width depending on comfort.
4. Pull the bar down toward your upper chest by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows pointed down and back, while maintaining a stable core and upright torso.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Kneel on one knee facing the anchor. Hold the bar with palms facing you, pull it to your upper chest while squeezing shoulder blades, then release slowly. Keep your core stable and repeat.

name: Half kneeling neutral grip lat pull down with Handle band
variations: Half kneeling overhand lat pull down with Handle band
Half kneeling underhand lat pull down with Handle band
written_instructions:
1. Anchor the handle band to a sturdy overhead point. Each handle is free to hold in one hand.
2. Kneel on one knee (half-kneeling) with the other foot forward for balance, facing the anchor.
3. Grab a handle in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
4. Pull the handles down toward your upper chest by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows pointed down and back, while maintaining a stable core and upright torso.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Kneel on one knee facing the anchor. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other. Pull the handles to your upper chest while squeezing shoulder blades, then release slowly. Keep your core stable and repeat.
