name: Half kneeling single arm lat pull down
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to a high pulley on a cable machine.
2. Kneel on one knee (half-kneeling) with the other foot forward for balance, facing the machine.
3. Grab the handle with one hand, keeping your palm facing inward (neutral grip) or slightly angled depending on comfort.
4. Pull the handle down toward your upper chest by bending your elbow and squeezing the lat and shoulder blade, keeping your torso upright and stable. Avoid leaning excessively.
5. Slowly return the handle to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps. Switch sides and repeat.
audio_script: Kneel on one knee facing the cable machine with the pulley set high. Hold the single-handle with one hand. Pull it down toward your upper chest while squeezing your lat and shoulder blade, then release slowly. Keep your torso stable. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Half kneeling single arm banded lat pull down
variations: Cross body banded lat pull around
progression: Cross body banded lat pull around
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a loop band to a sturdy overhead point.
2. Kneel on one knee (half-kneeling) with the other foot forward for balance, facing the anchor.
3. Grab the single-grip handle with one hand. Keep your other hand on your hip or supporting your torso.
4. Pull the handle down toward your upper chest by bending your elbow and squeezing the lat and shoulder blade, keeping your torso upright and stable.
5. Slowly return the handle to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps. Switch sides and repeat.
audio_script: Kneel on one knee facing the anchor, which should be above your head. Hold the single-handle with one hand. Pull it down toward your upper chest while squeezing your lat and shoulder blade, then release slowly. Keep your torso stable. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Cross body lat pull around
prerequisite_exercise: Half kneeling single arm lat pull down
variations: Half kneeling single arm lat pull down
regression: Half kneeling single arm lat pull down
written_instructions:
1. Set the cable pulley high and attach a single-grip handle.
2. Kneel on the same-side knee as the working hand, with the opposite foot forward for stability, perpendicular to the machine.
3. Grab the handle with the hand furthest from the machine. Keep your opposite hand on your hip or supporting your torso.
4. Pull the handle diagonally across your torso toward your opposite hip, keeping your elbow slightly bent and squeezing the shoulder blade and lat. Keep your torso upright and core engaged.
5. Slowly return the handle to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps. Switch sides and repeat.
audio_script: Kneel on the same-side knee as the working hand, with your opposite foot forward, perpendicular to the cable machine with the pulley set high. Hold the handle with the hand furthest from the machine. Pull it diagonally across your torso toward your opposite hip while squeezing your shoulder blade and lat, then return slowly. Keep your torso upright and core engaged. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Cross body banded lat pull around
variations: Half kneeling single arm banded lat pull down
regression: Half kneeling single arm banded lat pull down
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a single loop band to a high point (roughly head height or slightly above).
2. Kneel on the same-side knee as the working hand, with the opposite foot forward for stability, perpendicular to the anchor.
3. Attach the handle to the band and grab it with the hand furthest from the anchor. Keep your opposite hand on your hip or supporting your torso.
4. Pull the handle diagonally across your torso toward your opposite hip, keeping your elbow slightly bent and squeezing the shoulder blade and lat. Maintain an upright torso and engaged core.
5. Slowly return the handle to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps. Switch sides and repeat.
audio_script: Anchor a loop band high, kneel on the same-side knee as the working hand, and place your opposite foot forward. Grab the handle with the hand furthest from the anchor. Pull it diagonally across your torso toward your opposite hip, squeezing your lat and shoulder blade, then return slowly. Keep your torso upright and core engaged. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Renegade dumbbell row
variations: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
regression: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
written_instructions:
1. Start in a high plank position with a dumbbell in each hand, wrists under shoulders, and feet slightly wider than hip-width for balance.
2. Keep your core tight, back flat, and hips squared to the floor.
3. Row one dumbbell by pulling your elbow toward the ceiling, keeping it close to your body, while stabilizing with the opposite arm.
4. Lower the dumbbell under control back to the floor, then repeat the row on the other side.
5. Alternate sides for the desired number of reps, maintaining a stable torso and neutral spine throughout.
audio_script: Get into a high plank with a dumbbell in each hand, feet wide for balance. Row one dumbbell toward the ceiling, elbow close to your body, then lower it slowly. Alternate sides, keeping your core tight and hips squared.

name: Pendlay row
written_instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and a barbell in front of you on the floor. Hinge at your hips and bend your knees slightly to grab the bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your back flat, chest forward, and core tight, with your torso roughly parallel to the floor.
3. Row the barbell by pulling it explosively toward your lower chest/upper abdomen, driving with your elbows and keeping them close to your body.
4. Lower the barbell under control to the floor, allowing it to rest completely before the next rep — this distinguishes it from a regular bent-over row.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your torso parallel to the floor and avoiding any torso swing.
audio_script: Stand hip-width with a barbell on the floor. Hinge at your hips, grab it overhand, and keep your back flat. Pull the bar explosively to your lower chest, then lower it fully to the floor. Reset each rep, keeping your torso parallel and core tight.

name: Inverted row
written_instructions:
1. Set the bar of a Smith machine at roughly waist height. Lie underneath it and grab the bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Position your body straight from head to heels, engaging your core and glutes. Keep your heels on the floor and arms fully extended.
3. Pull your chest toward the bar by driving your elbows back and keeping them close to your body.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your shoulder blades together, then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, maintaining a straight body line and controlled movement throughout.
audio_script: Set a Smith machine bar at waist height. Lie underneath and grab it overhand. Keep your body straight, pull your chest to the bar, squeeze your shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Maintain a tight core and straight line from head to heels.

name: Meadows row
written_instructions:
1. Place one end of a barbell into a landmine base. Load the opposite end with the desired weight plates. Stand perpendicular to the bar with your feet hip-width apart, barbell on your side.
2. Hinge at your hips and bend your knees slightly, keeping your back flat and chest up, and grab the loaded end with your inside hand (hand closest to the bar).
3. Row the barbell by pulling your elbow back and up toward your torso, focusing on squeezing your lats and keeping your shoulder blade engaged.
4. Lower the barbell under control back to the starting position, fully extending your arm.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch sides. Keep your torso stable and avoid twisting your spine during the movement.
audio_script: Place one end of a barbell into a landmine base and load the other end with weight. Stand perpendicular, hinge at your hips, grab the loaded end with the inside hand. Pull your elbow back and up, squeeze your lat, then lower slowly. Keep your torso stable. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Landmine row
written_instructions:
1. Place one end of a barbell into a landmine base and load the opposite end with the desired weight plates. Stand straddling the bar, feet shoulder-width apart, so the bar passes under your legs.
2. Hinge at your hips and bend your knees slightly, keeping your back flat, chest up, and core engaged. Grab the loaded end with both hands using a neutral grip (palms facing each other), keeping arms fully extended.
3. Row the barbell by pulling it toward your lower chest or upper abdomen, driving elbows back and squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Lower the barbell under control back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, maintaining a flat back, tight core, and stable torso, avoiding any twisting or jerking motions.
audio_script: Place one end of a barbell in a landmine base and load the other end. Stand over the bar so it passes under your legs. Hinge at your hips, grab the bar with both hands, and row it to your lower chest or upper abdomen. Squeeze your shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Keep your back flat and torso stable throughout.

name: Single arm landmine row
written_instructions:
1. Place one end of a barbell into a landmine base and load the opposite end with the desired weight plates. Stand perpendicular to the bar with your feet hip-width apart, barbell on your side.
2. Hinge at your hips and bend your knees slightly, keeping your back flat, chest up, and core engaged. Grab the loaded end with your inside hand (hand closest to the bar) using a neutral grip (palm facing in).
3. Row the barbell by pulling your elbow back and slightly up toward your torso, focusing on squeezing your lats and keeping your shoulder blade engaged.
4. Lower the barbell under control back to the starting position, fully extending your arm.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch arms. Maintain torso stability and avoid twisting your spine during the movement.
audio_script: Place one end of a barbell in a landmine base and load the other end. Stand perpendicular, hinge at your hips, grab the loaded end with your inside hand. Pull your elbow back and slightly up, squeeze your lat, then lower slowly. Keep your torso stable. Repeat, then switch arms.

name: Pullover machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the pullover machine and rest your upper arms against the vertical pads, keeping your elbows aligned with the pads. Your chest should remain upright and close to the backrest if present.
2. Grasp the bar above your head with an overhand grip (palms facing away from you), ensuring your hands are shoulder-width apart.
3. Start with your elbows bent and the bar positioned above your head, maintaining contact with the pads.
4. Press the bar down and forward in a controlled motion by extending your elbows and driving through the pads, until your arms are almost straight or in line with your torso. Focus on engaging your lats.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control, keeping your elbows on the pads, then repeat for the desired reps. Maintain a stable torso and tight core throughout.
audio_script: Sit and rest your upper arms on the vertical pads. Grab the bar above your head with an overhand grip. Press down and forward through the pads, squeezing your lats, then slowly return. Keep your torso stable and repeat.

name: Plate loaded lat pull down machine
equipment: Plate loaded lat pull down machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the machine and adjust the thigh pad so it rests snugly against your thighs to prevent your body from lifting during the exercise.
2. Grasp the lat pulldown bar with the desired grip: wide overhand grip (palms away) or neutral grip (palms facing each other).
3. Start with your arms fully extended overhead and your torso upright, slightly leaning back if necessary for comfort.
4. Pull the bar down toward your upper chest or collarbone, leading with your elbows and focusing on engaging your lats. Avoid using momentum; keep your torso stable.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, fully extending your arms, then repeat for the desired reps. Maintain a tight core and neutral spine throughout.
audio_script: Sit and secure your thighs under the pad. Grab the bar with the desired grip. Pull it down to your upper chest, squeezing your lats, then return slowly. Keep your torso stable and repeat.

name: Chest supported T-bar rows
written_instructions:
1. Lie chest-down on the chest-supported T-bar row machine, with your feet firmly on the footrests or floor.
2. Grab the handles with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) or overhand grip depending on your setup.
3. Start with your arms fully extended and shoulders relaxed.
4. Row the handles toward your lower chest or upper abdomen, driving your elbows back and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the handles under control back to the starting position, fully extending your arms, then repeat for the desired reps. Keep your torso pressed against the pad and avoid using momentum.
audio_script: Lie chest-down on the pad, feet on the floor. Grab the handles with a neutral or overhand grip. Row the handles to your lower chest, squeeze your shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Keep your torso pressed against the pad and repeat.

name: Seated close neutral-grip cable row
variations: Seated single arm row with rope
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the cable row machine with your feet firmly on the footrests and knees slightly bent.
2. Grab the V-bar or close-grip handle with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
3. Sit upright with your chest tall, shoulders relaxed, and arms fully extended toward the weight stack.
4. Pull the handle toward your lower chest or upper abdomen, leading with your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position under control, keeping your torso stable, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit with feet on the footrests and knees slightly bent. Grab the V-bar with a neutral grip. Pull it to your lower chest, squeeze your shoulder blades, then slowly return. Keep your torso stable and repeat.

name: Seated wide neutral-grip cable row
variations: Seated single arm row with rope
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the cable row machine with your feet firmly on the footrests and knees slightly bent.
2. Grab the wide neutral-grip handle (handles at each end of the bar) with palms facing each other.
3. Sit upright with your chest tall, shoulders relaxed, and arms fully extended toward the weight stack.
4. Pull the handle toward your upper abdomen or lower chest, leading with your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position under control, keeping your torso stable, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit with feet on the footrests and knees slightly bent. Grab the wide neutral-grip handle, palms facing each other. Pull it to your upper abdomen, squeeze your shoulder blades, then slowly return. Keep your torso stable and repeat.

name: Seated close overhand-grip cable row
variations: Seated single arm row with rope
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the cable row machine with your feet firmly on the footrests and knees slightly bent.
2. Grab a straight bar attachment with a pronated (overhand) grip, palms facing down.
3. Sit upright with your chest tall, shoulders relaxed, and arms fully extended toward the weight stack.
4. Pull the bar toward your lower chest or upper abdomen, leading with your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position under control, keeping your torso stable, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit with feet on the footrests and knees slightly bent. Grab the straight bar with an overhand grip, palms down. Pull it to your lower chest, squeeze your shoulder blades, then slowly return. Keep your torso stable and repeat.

name: Seated wide overhand-grip cable row
variations: Seated single arm row with rope
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the cable row machine with your feet firmly on the footrests and knees slightly bent.
2. Grab a wide straight bar attachment with a pronated (overhand) grip, palms facing down.
3. Sit upright with your chest tall, shoulders relaxed, and arms fully extended toward the weight stack.
4. Pull the bar toward your upper abdomen or lower chest, leading with your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position under control, keeping your torso stable, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit with feet on the footrests and knees slightly bent. Grab a wide straight bar with an overhand grip, palms down. Pull it to your upper abdomen, squeeze your shoulder blades, then slowly return. Keep your torso stable and repeat.

name: Seated close underhand-grip cable row
variations: Seated single arm row with rope
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the cable row machine with your feet firmly on the footrests and knees slightly bent.
2. Grab a straight bar attachment with a supinated (underhand) grip, palms facing up.
3. Sit upright with your chest tall, shoulders relaxed, and arms fully extended toward the weight stack.
4. Pull the bar toward your lower chest or upper abdomen, leading with your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position under control, keeping your torso stable, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit with feet on the footrests and knees slightly bent. Grab a straight bar with an underhand grip, palms up. Pull it to your lower chest, squeeze your shoulder blades, then slowly return. Keep your torso stable and repeat.

name: Seated cable row with rope
variations: Seated single arm row with rope
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the cable row machine with your feet firmly on the footrests and knees slightly bent.
2. Grab the rope attachment with a neutral grip, palms facing each other.
3. Sit upright with your chest tall, shoulders relaxed, and arms fully extended toward the weight stack.
4. Pull the rope toward your upper abdomen or lower chest, keeping elbows close to your torso and allowing the rope ends to spread apart at the end of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top.
5. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position under control, keeping your torso stable, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit with feet on the footrests and knees slightly bent. Grab the rope with a neutral grip, palms facing each other. Pull it to your upper abdomen, letting the rope ends spread, squeeze your shoulder blades, then slowly return. Keep your torso stable and repeat.

name: Seated single arm row
variations: Seated single arm row with rope
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the cable row machine with your feet firmly on the footrests and knees slightly bent.
2. Grab a single D-handle with one hand, using a neutral grip (palm facing in).
3. Sit upright with your chest tall, shoulders relaxed, and the working arm fully extended toward the weight stack.
4. Pull the handle toward your upper abdomen or lower chest, leading with your elbow and squeezing your shoulder blade at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly extend your arm back to the starting position under control, keeping your torso stable. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch to the other arm.
audio_script: Sit with feet on the footrests and knees slightly bent. Grab a single D-handle with one hand, palm facing in. Pull it to your upper abdomen, squeeze your shoulder blade, then slowly return. Keep your torso stable and repeat, then switch arms.

name: Seated single arm row with rope
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the cable row machine with your feet firmly on the footrests and knees slightly bent.
2. Grab one end of the rope attachment with one hand, using a neutral grip (palm facing in).
3. Sit upright with your chest tall, shoulders relaxed, and the working arm fully extended toward the weight stack.
4. Pull the rope toward your upper abdomen or lower chest, leading with your elbow and squeezing your shoulder blade at the top of the movement. Let the rope end naturally flare out at the top.
5. Slowly extend your arm back to the starting position under control, keeping your torso stable. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch to the other arm.
audio_script: Sit with feet on the footrests and knees slightly bent. Grab one end of the rope with a neutral grip. Pull it to your upper abdomen, let the rope end flare, squeeze your shoulder blade, then slowly return. Keep your torso stable and repeat, then switch arms.

name: plated overhand-grip row machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the row machine with your chest against the pad (if available) or upright on the seat, and your feet firmly on the footrests.
2. Grab the handles of the machine with an overhand (pronated) grip, palms facing down.
3. Sit tall with your chest up, shoulders relaxed, and arms fully extended toward the weight stack or plates.
4. Pull the handles toward your upper abdomen or lower chest, leading with your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position under control, keeping your torso stable, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit with your chest upright, feet on the footrests. Grab the handles with an overhand grip, palms down. Pull the handles to your upper abdomen, squeeze your shoulder blades, then slowly return. Keep your torso stable and repeat.

name: plated neutral-grip row machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the row machine with your chest against the pad (if available) or upright on the seat, and your feet firmly on the footrests.
2. Grab the handles of the machine with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
3. Sit tall with your chest up, shoulders relaxed, and arms fully extended toward the weight stack or plates.
4. Pull the handles toward your upper abdomen or lower chest, leading with your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position under control, keeping your torso stable, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit with your chest upright, feet on the footrests. Grab the handles with a neutral grip, palms facing each other. Pull the handles to your upper abdomen, squeeze your shoulder blades, then slowly return. Keep your torso stable and repeat.

name: Straight arm lat pull down with bar
variations: Bent-over Straight arm lat pull down with bar
Straight arm lat pull down with rope
Bent-over straight arm lat pull down with rope
progression: Bent-over Straight arm lat pull down with bar
written_instructions:
1. Stand facing a high pulley with a curl bar attached to the cable, feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent.
2. Grab the bar with an overhand (pronated) grip, hands about shoulder-width apart.
3. Keep your arms fully extended in front of you and maintain a slight bend in the knees, chest up, and core engaged.
4. Pull the bar down toward your thighs in a controlled motion, keeping arms straight throughout the movement, focusing on contracting your lats.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley with a curl bar. Grab it overhand, arms straight. Pull the bar down toward your thighs, keeping arms straight and lats engaged, then slowly return. Repeat.

name: Bent-over Straight arm lat pull down with bar
variations: Straight arm lat pull down with bar
Straight arm lat pull down with rope
Bent-over straight arm lat pull down with rope
regression: Straight arm lat pull down with bar
written_instructions:
1. Attach a bar (e.g., curl bar or straight bar) to a high pulley. Stand facing the pulley with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor, knees slightly bent, and core engaged. Your arms should start overhead, holding the bar with an overhand (pronated) grip.
3. Keep your arms fully extended, shoulders down, and chest slightly lifted.
4. Pull the bar down in a controlled arc toward your thighs, keeping your arms straight and focusing on contracting your lats.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting overhead position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley, hinge at your hips so your torso is parallel to the floor, arms overhead holding the bar. Pull the bar down in an arc toward your thighs, keeping arms straight and lats engaged. Slowly return and repeat.

name: Straight arm lat pull down with rope
variations: Straight arm lat pull down with bar
Bent-over Straight arm lat pull down with bar
Bent-over straight arm lat pull down with rope
progression: Bent-over straight arm lat pull down with rope
written_instructions:

2. Hold the rope ends with an overhand (pronated) grip, arms fully extended overhead.
3. Keep your arms straight, shoulders down, chest lifted, and core engaged.
4. Pull the rope down in an arc toward your thighs, letting the ends separate naturally as you reach the bottom. Focus on contracting your lats without leaning or swinging your torso.
5. Slowly return the rope to the starting overhead position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley with rope overhead, arms straight, torso upright. Pull the rope down in an arc toward your thighs, letting the ends separate, squeezing your lats. Slowly return and repeat.

name: Bent-over two-arm dumbbell row
variations: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
regression: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
written_instructions:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) and stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor (slight bend in the knees), keeping your core tight and back flat. Let the dumbbells hang straight down from your shoulders.
3. Keep your arms fully extended, shoulders down, and chest slightly lifted.
4. Pull the dumbbells simultaneously toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together. Keep elbows tucked close to your body and torso stationary.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand, hinge at your hips until torso is parallel to the floor, arms straight. Pull the dumbbells toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Bent-over two-arm underhand dumbbell row
variations: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
regression: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
written_instructions:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand (supinated) grip — palms facing forward — and stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor (slight bend in the knees), keeping your core tight and back flat. Let the dumbbells hang straight down from your shoulders.
3. Keep your arms fully extended, shoulders down, and chest slightly lifted.
4. Pull the dumbbells simultaneously toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows close to your body and torso stationary.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing forward, hinge at your hips until torso is parallel to the floor. Pull the dumbbells toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
written_instructions:
1. Place your left knee and left hand on a flat bench for support, keeping your back flat and core engaged. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand with a neutral grip (palm facing your torso).
2. Position your right foot on the floor for stability and let your right arm hang straight down from your shoulder, dumbbell in hand.
3. Keep your shoulder down and chest slightly lifted.
4. Pull the dumbbell toward your torso by bending your elbow and squeezing your shoulder blade toward your spine, keeping your torso stationary.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbell to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Place your left knee and hand on a bench, hold a dumbbell in your right hand. Pull the dumbbell toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blade. Lower slowly and repeat. Switch sides.

name: Chest supported dumbbell rows
variations: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
written_instructions:
1. Set an incline bench at about 30–45 degrees. Lie face down on the bench with your chest supported and feet firmly on the ground or bench supports. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other), letting the arms hang straight down.
2. Keep your shoulders down, chest pressed lightly against the bench, and core engaged.
3. Pull the dumbbells toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows close to your body.
4. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, focusing on contracting the lats and upper back.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie face down on an incline bench with dumbbells in each hand. Pull the dumbbells toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Bent-over underhand barbell row
written_instructions:
1. Grip a barbell with an underhand (supinated) grip — palms facing forward — at about shoulder width. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor (slight bend in the knees), keeping your back flat and core tight. Let the barbell hang straight down from your shoulders.
3. Keep your arms fully extended, shoulders down, and chest slightly lifted.
4. Pull the barbell toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows close to your body and torso stationary.
5. Slowly lower the barbell to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Grip a barbell with palms facing forward, hinge at your hips until torso is parallel to the floor. Pull the barbell toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Bent-over overhand barbell row
written_instructions:
1. Grip a barbell with an overhand (pronated) grip — palms facing toward you — at about shoulder width. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor (slight bend in the knees), keeping your back flat and core engaged. Let the barbell hang straight down from your shoulders.
3. Keep your arms fully extended, shoulders down, and chest slightly lifted.
4. Pull the barbell toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows close to your body and torso stationary.
5. Slowly lower the barbell to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Grip a barbell with palms facing you, hinge at your hips until torso is parallel to the floor. Pull the barbell toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Half kneeling underhand row with loop band
variations: Half kneeling Overhand row with loop band
Half kneeling neutral grip row with loop band
written_instructions:
1. Anchor the middle of the loop band to a sturdy point so that when you kneel, the band is roughly at chest height.
2. Step into a half-kneeling position, right knee down and left foot forward (or opposite, depending on stability).
3. Grab one handle in each hand with an underhand grip (palms facing up), ensuring both sides of the band are equal.
4. Pull the handles toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades, keeping your torso upright and core engaged.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control and repeat for desired reps, switching legs if needed.
audio_script: Anchor the middle of the band so that when you kneel, it is roughly at chest height. Step into a half-kneeling position, hold the handles with palms up. Pull toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat. Switch sides.

name: Half kneeling underhand row with Handle band
variations: Half kneeling overhand row with Handle band
Half kneeling neutral grip row with Handle band
written_instructions:
1. Anchor the middle of the handle band to a sturdy point so that when you kneel, the band is roughly at chest height.
2. Step into a half-kneeling position.
3. Grab both handles with an underhand grip (palms facing up), keeping tension equal on both sides.
4. Pull the handles toward your torso, bending elbows and squeezing shoulder blades, keeping torso upright.
5. Slowly extend arms back to the starting position under control and repeat, switching legs if needed.
audio_script: Anchor the middle of the band so that when you kneel, it is roughly at chest height. Step into a half-kneeling position, hold a handle in each hand with palms up, equal tension on both sides. Pull toward your torso, squeezing shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Half kneeling Overhand row with loop band
variations: Half kneeling underhand row with loop band
Half kneeling neutral grip row with loop band
written_instructions:
1. Anchor the middle of the loop band so that when kneeling, the band is roughly at chest height.
2. Step into a half-kneeling position.
3. Grab one handle in each hand with an overhand grip (palms facing down), keeping both sides of the band equal.
4. Pull the handles toward your torso by bending elbows and squeezing shoulder blades, torso upright and core tight.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control and repeat, switching legs if needed.
audio_script: Anchor the middle of the band so that when you kneel, it is roughly at chest height. Step into a half-kneeling position, hold a handle in each hand with palms down, equal tension on both sides. Pull toward your torso, squeezing shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Underhand row with loop band
variations: Neutral grip row with loop band
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of the loop band, then anchor the middle of the band to a sturdy point at about waist to chest height.
2. Stand facing the anchor with a staggered feet position (one foot slightly forward) for more stability, knees slightly bent, and core engaged.
3. Grab one handle in each hand with an underhand grip (palms facing up), making sure both sides of the band are equal in length.
4. Pull the handles toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping your torso upright.
5. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position under control, maintaining tension in the band, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Attach a handle to each end of a loop band and anchor the middle at waist to chest height. Stand facing it with a staggered stance for stability, knees slightly bent. Grab the handles palms up, pull toward your torso while squeezing shoulder blades, then extend arms back slowly. Repeat.

name: Neutral grip row with Handle band
written_instructions:
