3. Grab both handles in your hands with a neutral grip (palms facing each other), making sure both sides of the band are equal in length.
4. Pull the handles toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping your torso upright.
5. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position under control, maintaining tension in the band, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Anchor the middle of a handle band at waist to chest height. Stand facing it with a staggered stance for stability, knees slightly bent. Grab both handles palms facing each other, pull toward your torso while squeezing shoulder blades, then extend arms back slowly. Repeat.

name: Half kneeling rope row
written_instructions:
1. Attach a rope handle to a cable machine pulley set at torso height (relative to your kneeling position).
2. Kneel on one knee and place the opposite foot forward on the floor to create a stable staggered stance.
3. Grab the rope with both hands, palms facing each other, arms fully extended, torso upright, and core engaged.
4. Pull the rope toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping your torso stable.
5. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Attach a rope to a pulley set at torso height. Kneel on one knee with the opposite foot forward for stability. Grab the rope with both hands, palms facing each other, pull toward your torso while squeezing shoulder blades, then slowly extend arms back. Repeat.

name: Half kneeling band rope row
written_instructions:
1. Anchor the middle of a loop band to a sturdy point at approximately torso height (relative to your kneeling position).
2. Attach a rope attachment to the anchored band.
3. Kneel on one knee with the opposite foot forward for stability.
4. Grab the rope with both hands, arms fully extended, torso upright, and core engaged.
5. Pull the rope toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades, keeping your torso stable. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Anchor the middle of a loop band at torso height, then attach a rope. Kneel on one knee, opposite foot forward for stability. Grab the rope with both hands, pull toward your torso while squeezing shoulder blades, then slowly extend back. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell shrugs
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms fully extended at your sides, palms facing your torso.
2. Keep your back straight, chest up, and core engaged.
3. Shrug your shoulders upward as high as possible toward your ears, avoiding bending your elbows.
4. Hold the contraction at the top for 1–2 seconds, focusing on squeezing the traps.
5. Slowly lower your shoulders back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand with dumbbells at your sides. Keep your back straight and shrug your shoulders up toward your ears. Hold briefly, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Barbell shrugs
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your thighs with a pronated grip (palms facing your body).
2. Keep your back straight, chest up, and core engaged.
3. Shrug your shoulders upward as high as possible toward your ears, avoiding bending your elbows.
4. Hold the contraction at the top for 1–2 seconds, focusing on squeezing the traps.
5. Slowly lower your shoulders back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand with a barbell in front of your thighs. Keep your back straight and shrug your shoulders up toward your ears. Hold briefly, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Barbell curl
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an underhand (supinated) grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your elbows close to your torso, back straight, and core engaged.
3. Curl the barbell upward toward your chest by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand with a barbell in an underhand grip. Keep elbows close to your torso and curl the barbell up toward your chest. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Barbell reverse curl
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand (pronated) grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your elbows close to your torso, back straight, and core engaged.
3. Curl the barbell upward toward your chest by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand with a barbell in an overhand grip. Keep elbows close to your torso and curl the barbell up toward your chest. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Barbell preacher curl
written_instructions:
1. Sit on a preacher bench and place your upper arms flat against the pad. Hold a barbell with an underhand (supinated) grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep your chest against the bench and your back straight.
3. Curl the barbell upward by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms pressed to the pad.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position without fully locking your elbows.
5. Repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on a preacher bench with your upper arms on the pad. Hold a barbell underhand, curl it up, then lower slowly without locking your elbows. Repeat.

name: Barbell spider curl
written_instructions:
1. Set up an incline bench at about 45 degrees and lie chest-down, letting your arms hang straight down toward the floor. Hold a barbell with an underhand (supinated) grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep your chest pressed against the bench and your back straight.
3. Curl the barbell upward by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms fixed and perpendicular to the floor.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
5. Repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie chest-down on an incline bench with arms hanging. Hold a barbell underhand, curl it up, then lower slowly, fully extending your arms. Repeat.

name: Standing dumbbell curl
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand (supinated) grip.
2. Keep your elbows close to your torso and your back straight.
3. Curl the dumbbells upward by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
5. Repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand with dumbbells at your sides, palms facing forward. Curl them up without moving your upper arms, then lower slowly, fully extending your arms. Repeat.

name: Seated dumbbell curl
written_instructions:
1. Sit on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand (supinated) grip.
2. Keep your back straight, chest up, and elbows close to your torso.
3. Curl the dumbbells upward by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
5. Repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on a bench with feet flat, dumbbells at your sides, palms forward. Curl them up without moving your upper arms, then lower slowly, fully extending your arms. Repeat.

name: Alternating bicep curl
written_instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended by your sides and palms facing forward.
2. Keep your back straight, chest up, and core engaged.
3. Curl one dumbbell upward toward your shoulder, fully contracting the bicep.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat the movement with the opposite arm, alternating for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, palms forward. Curl one dumbbell fully to your shoulder, lower slowly, then curl the other. Keep alternating.

name: Alternating seated bicep curls
written_instructions:
1. Sit on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand (supinated) grip, palms facing forward.
2. Keep your elbows close to your torso and your back straight; avoid leaning back.
3. Curl one dumbbell fully toward your shoulder by bending the elbow, keeping your upper arm stationary.
4. Slowly lower that dumbbell back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat with the other arm, alternating for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit tall on a flat bench, feet flat. Hold dumbbells palms forward. Curl one dumbbell fully to your shoulder, lower it, then curl the other. Alternate arms for each rep, keeping your back straight.

name: Hammer curl
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended at your sides.
2. Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip — palms facing each other.
3. Keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the dumbbells upward by bending your elbows, maintaining the neutral grip.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, either simultaneously or alternating arms.
audio_script: Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing each other. Curl the dumbbells up while keeping palms facing each other, then lower them slowly. Repeat.

name: Seated hammer curls
written_instructions:
1. Sit on a flat bench with feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip — palms facing each other.
3. Keep your upper arms stationary and curl the dumbbells upward by bending your elbows, maintaining the neutral grip.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position under control, without swinging.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing each other. Curl the dumbbells up while keeping palms facing each other, then lower them slowly. Repeat.

name: Alternating hammer curl
written_instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended at your sides.
2. Keep a neutral grip — palms facing each other throughout the movement.
3. Curl one dumbbell upward by bending the elbow while keeping the other arm stationary.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position under control, then curl the other dumbbell.
5. Continue alternating for the desired number of reps, completing one full rep with each arm before switching.
audio_script: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. Curl one dumbbell while keeping the other still, then lower it slowly. Curl the other dumbbell. Repeat, alternating.

name: Crossbody hammer curl
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
2. Keep your arms fully extended at your sides.
3. Curl the dumbbell across your body toward the opposite shoulder, keeping the other arm stationary.
4. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the starting position under control.
5. Alternate arms for the desired number of reps, completing one full rep with each arm before switching.
audio_script: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. Curl one dumbbell diagonally across your body toward the opposite shoulder, then lower it slowly. Alternate arms. Repeat.

name: Zottman Curl
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
2. Keep your elbows close to your torso, and curl the dumbbells up toward your shoulders.
3. At the top, rotate your wrists so your palms face downward (pronated grip).
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position, rotating your wrists back to supinated grip as you reach the bottom.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with dumbbells, palms forward. Curl up, rotate wrists so palms face down at the top, then slowly lower while rotating wrists back to palms forward. Repeat.

name: Inclined dumbbell curl
written_instructions:
1. Sit on an incline bench (45–60°) holding a dumbbell in each hand with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
2. Let your arms hang fully extended at your sides, elbows close to your torso, back resting against the bench.
3. Curl the dumbbells upward toward your shoulders in a controlled manner.
4. Lower the dumbbells slowly back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit on an incline bench with dumbbells in hand, palms forward. Let arms hang fully extended. Curl up toward shoulders, then slowly lower back down. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell preacher curl
written_instructions:
1. Sit on a preacher bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms resting on the angled pad.
2. Hold the dumbbells with a supinated grip (palms facing up).
3. Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders while keeping your upper arms against the pad.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back toward the starting position, avoiding locking your elbows.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit on a preacher bench with dumbbells in hand, palms up. Rest arms on the pad. Curl up toward shoulders, then slowly lower back down, without locking your elbows.

name: Dumbbell spider curl
written_instructions:
1. Lie face down on an incline bench, chest supported, with a dumbbell in each hand.
2. Let your arms hang straight down, holding the dumbbells with a supinated grip (palms facing up).
3. Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie face down on an incline bench, dumbbells in hand, palms up. Let arms hang. Curl up toward shoulders, then slowly lower back down, fully extending your arms.

name: Alternating dumbbell spider curl
written_instructions:
1. Lie face down on an incline bench, chest supported, with a dumbbell in each hand.
2. Let your arms hang straight down, holding the dumbbells with a supinated grip (palms facing up).
3. Curl one dumbbell toward your shoulder while the other arm remains extended.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position, fully extending your arm, then repeat with the other arm.
5. Continue alternating for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie face down on an incline bench, dumbbells in hand, palms up. Curl one dumbbell toward your shoulder, then slowly lower back down fully extending the arm. Repeat with the other arm, alternating.

name: Rope Hammer Curl
written_instructions:
1. Attach a rope to a low pulley on a cable machine.
2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the rope with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
3. Keep elbows close to your torso.
4. Curl the rope upward toward your shoulders.
5. Slowly lower the rope back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand in front of a low pulley, holding the rope with palms facing each other. Curl upward toward your shoulders, then slowly lower back down, keeping elbows slightly bent.

name: Standing Cable Curl with bar
written_instructions:
1. Attach a curl bar to a low pulley on a cable machine.
2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the bar with a supinated grip (palms facing up).
3. Keep elbows close to your torso.
4. Curl the bar upward toward your shoulders.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand in front of a low pulley holding a curl bar with palms up. Curl toward your shoulders, then slowly lower back down. Repeat.

name: Single arm cable curl
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single grip handle to a low pulley on a cable machine.
2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the handle with a supinated grip (palm facing up).
3. Keep your elbow close to your torso.
4. Curl the handle upward toward your shoulder.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand in front of a low pulley holding a single handle with palm up. Curl toward your shoulder, then slowly lower back down. Repeat.

name: Bayesian Cable Curl
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single grip handle to a low pulley on a cable machine.
2. Stand facing away from the machine with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the handle with a supinated grip (palm facing up).
3. Keep your elbow close to your torso.
4. Curl the handle toward your shoulder in a controlled motion.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position, fully extending your elbow.
audio_script: Stand facing away from a low pulley with a single handle, palm up. Curl toward your shoulder, then slowly return to start, fully extending your arm.

name: Single Arm High Cable Curl
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single grip handle to a high pulley on a cable machine.
2. Stand to the side of the pulley, feet shoulder-width apart, holding the handle with a supinated grip (palm facing up).
3. Extend your working arm out to the side at shoulder height.
4. Curl the handle toward your shoulder in a controlled motion, keeping your upper arm roughly parallel to the floor.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position, fully extending your arm. Repeat for desired reps.
audio_script: Stand to the side of a high pulley, arm out to the side, palm up. Curl toward your shoulder, then slowly return to start, fully extending your arm.

name: Bicep curls with loop band
variations: Alternating bicep curls with loop band
regression: Alternating bicep curls with loop band
written_instructions:
1. Attach single grip handles to each end of a loop band.
2. Grab the handles with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
3. Step on the middle of the band with one foot, standing with feet staggered for stability.
4. Curl the handles up toward your shoulders, keeping elbows soft and controlled.
5. Slowly lower back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Attach handles to loop band, grab with palms forward, step on middle of band. Curl up toward shoulders, then slowly lower. Repeat.

name: Alternating bicep curls with loop band
written_instructions:
1. Attach single grip handles to each end of a loop band.
2. Grab the handles with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
3. Step on the middle of the band with one foot, using a staggered stance for stability.
4. Curl one handle toward your shoulder while keeping the other arm extended.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position. Alternate arms for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Attach handles to loop band, grab with palms forward, step on middle of band. Curl one arm at a time toward shoulder, while keeping the other arm fully extended. Slowly lower. Alternate arms.

name: Bicep curls with Handle band
variations: Alternating bicep curls with Handle band
regression: Alternating bicep curls with Handle band
written_instructions:
1. Stand on the middle of a handle band with feet staggered for stability.
2. Grab the handles with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
3. Keep your elbows close to your torso.
4. Curl the handles toward your shoulders.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand on the middle of the handle band, grab handles palms forward. Curl toward shoulders, then slowly lower back down. Repeat.

name: Alternating bicep curls with Handle band
written_instructions:
1. Stand with one foot on the middle of the handle band and the other slightly behind for stability.
2. Grab the handles with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
3. Keep your elbows close to your torso.
4. Curl one handle toward your shoulder while keeping the other arm extended.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position, then repeat with the opposite arm. Continue alternating for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand on the handle band with one foot, grab handles palms forward. Curl one arm toward shoulder, lower it, then curl the other. Repeat alternating.

name: Bodyweight squats
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep your chest upright, shoulders back, and core engaged.
3. Begin the movement by pushing your hips back and bending your knees, lowering down as if sitting in a chair.
4. Go down until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor, keeping your weight evenly distributed across your feet.
5. Stand back up to the starting position by extending your hips and knees. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, chest up and core tight. Push your hips back and bend your knees, lowering down as if sitting in a chair. Go until your thighs are parallel to the floor, keeping weight evenly on your feet. Stand back up by extending your hips and knees. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight squats with lateral leg lifts
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
progression: Banded squat to lateral leg lifts
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, chest upright, core engaged.
2. Perform a standard bodyweight squat by pushing your hips back and bending your knees.
3. As you stand up, lift your right leg out to the side, keeping it straight.
4. Lower your leg back down as you go into the next squat.
5. Alternate legs with each squat and repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand tall, chest up, core tight. Squat down by pushing your hips back and bending your knees. As you stand up, lift one leg out to the side, then lower it as you go into the next squat. Alternate legs with each rep.

name: Banded squats
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
progression: Banded squat to lateral leg lifts
written_instructions:
1. Place a mini loop band just above your knees and stand with feet shoulder-width apart, chest upright, core engaged.
2. Perform a standard squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
3. Keep tension on the band throughout the movement, preventing your knees from caving inward.
4. Stand back up by straightening your legs, maintaining the band’s tension.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Place a mini loop band above your knees. Stand tall, chest up, core tight. Squat down by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping tension on the band. Stand up while maintaining the band’s resistance. Repeat.

name: Banded squat to lateral leg lifts
written_instructions:
1. Place a mini loop band just above your knees and stand with feet shoulder-width apart, chest upright, core engaged.
2. Perform a standard squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
3. Stand up from the squat and lift one leg out to the side, keeping the band under tension and core engaged.
4. Lower the leg back down and repeat the movement with the other leg.
5. Continue alternating leg lifts for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Place a mini loop band above your knees. Squat down by bending your knees and pushing hips back. Stand up and lift one leg to the side, keeping the band tight. Lower it and repeat with the other leg. Alternate for all reps.

name: Bodyweight sumo squat
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outward, chest upright, core engaged.
2. Bend your knees and push your hips back, lowering your body toward the floor.
3. Keep your weight evenly distributed across your feet.
4. Push through your feet to return to standing.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet wider than shoulders, toes pointing out. Lower your hips by bending your knees, keeping your chest up and weight evenly on your feet. Push back up to standing. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight pulse squats
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet about shoulder-width apart, chest upright, core engaged.
2. Lower down into a full squat.
3. Rise halfway up from the squat.
4. Lower back down to the full squat, then rise all the way to standing.
5. That full sequence counts as one rep; repeat for desired reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a full squat, rise halfway up, then lower back down and press all the way up to standing. That counts as one rep; repeat for desired reps.

name: Bodyweight jump squats
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet about shoulder-width apart, chest upright, core engaged.
2. Lower into a squat, keeping weight evenly distributed across your feet.
3. Explosively jump upward as you rise from the squat.
4. Land softly back into a squat position, absorbing impact with your legs.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a squat, then jump up explosively. Land softly back into the squat and repeat for desired reps.

name: Bodyweight cossack squat
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward or slightly outward.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and bend that knee, keeping the other leg straight, heel grounded, and toes slightly lifted if needed.
3. Lower your hips toward the bent knee, keeping your chest upright and core engaged.
4. Push through the bent leg to return to the starting wide stance.
5. Complete all reps on one leg before switching to the other leg.
audio_script: Stand with feet wide. Shift weight to one leg and lower hips, keeping the other leg straight, heel on the ground, toes lifted if needed. Return to wide stance. Complete all reps on that leg, then switch to the other leg.

name: Alternating bodyweight cossack squat
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward or slightly outward.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and bend that knee, keeping the other leg straight, heel grounded, and toes slightly lifted if needed for balance.
3. Lower your hips toward the bent knee, keeping your chest upright and core engaged.
4. Push through the bent leg to return to the starting wide stance, then immediately shift to the opposite leg.
5. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet wide. Shift weight to one leg, lower hips, keeping the other leg straight, heel on the ground, toes lifted if needed. Return to wide stance, then shift to the other leg. Alternate legs for each rep.

name: Bodyweight box squat
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward or slightly outward.
2. Place a sturdy box or bench behind you at a height where your thighs will be roughly parallel to the ground when seated.
3. Lower your hips back and down in a controlled motion until your glutes lightly touch the box, keeping your chest upright and core engaged.
4. Pause briefly on the box.
5. Push through your feet to return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, box behind you. Lower hips back to lightly touch the box, keeping chest up and core tight. Pause, then push through your feet to stand back up.

name: Bodyweight box sumo squat
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outward.
2. Place a sturdy box or bench behind you at a height where your thighs will be roughly parallel to the ground when seated.
3. Lower your hips back and down in a controlled motion until your glutes lightly touch the box, keeping your chest upright and core engaged.
4. Pause briefly on the box.
5. Press through your feet to return to standing. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet wide and toes slightly outward, box behind you. Lower hips back to lightly touch the box, keeping chest up and core tight. Pause, then press through your feet to stand back up.

name: Bodyweight single leg box squat
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
written_instructions:
1. Stand on one leg in front of a sturdy box or bench, the other leg slightly lifted in front of you for balance.
2. Lower your hips back and down in a controlled motion, bending the standing leg, until your glutes lightly touch the box. Keep your chest upright and core engaged.
3. Pause briefly on the box, maintaining tension in your leg muscles.
4. Press through your heel to rise back to standing.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch legs.
audio_script: Stand on one leg in front of a box, other leg slightly raised. Lower your hips to lightly touch the box, keeping chest up and core tight. Pause, then press through your heel to stand. Switch legs after desired reps.

name: Bodyweight pistol squat
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
written_instructions:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended straight in front of you, arms extended forward for balance if needed.
2. Lower your hips down and back in a controlled motion, keeping the extended leg off the ground. Maintain an upright torso and tight core.
3. Descend as far as your mobility allows, ideally until your thigh is parallel to the floor or lower.
4. Press through the heel of the standing leg to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for desired reps, then switch legs.
audio_script: Stand on one leg with the other extended in front. Lower hips down and back, keeping chest up and core engaged. Go as low as you can, then press through your heel to stand. Switch legs after reps.

name: Elevated bodyweight single leg squat
variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
written_instructions:
1. Stand on one leg on a raised surface (like a low step or platform), with the other leg extended forward for balance.
2. Lower your hips straight down in a controlled motion, letting the extended leg hover or lightly tap the ground if needed.
3. Descend as far as your mobility allows, ideally until the standing thigh is parallel to the platform or lower.
4. Press through the heel of the standing leg to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for desired reps, then switch legs.
audio_script: Stand on one leg on a raised surface with the other leg extended forward. Lower your hips carefully, letting the extended leg hover or lightly tap the ground. Go as low as your mobility allows, then press through your heel to stand. Switch legs after reps.

name: Wall sit
written_instructions:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart and about 1–2 feet away from the wall.
2. Slide your back down the wall until your knees are bent at approximately 90 degrees, thighs parallel to the floor.
3. Ensure your knees stay roughly above your heels and keep your back flat against the wall, engaging your core.
4. Hold this position for the desired duration, maintaining even weight distribution through your feet.
5. Slowly slide back up to standing to finish the set.
audio_script: Lean against a wall with your feet a bit away. Slide down until your thighs are parallel and knees are roughly above your heels. Keep your back flat and core engaged. Hold, then slide back up to stand.

name: Weighted wall sit
written_instructions:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart and about 1–2 feet away from the wall.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, keeping them at your sides or resting on your thighs.
3. Slide your back down the wall until your knees are bent at approximately 90 degrees, thighs parallel to the floor.
4. Ensure your knees stay roughly above your heels, back stays flat, and core is engaged.
5. Hold this position for the desired duration, then slowly slide back up to standing.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides and lean against a wall. Slide down until your thighs are parallel and knees are roughly above your heels. Keep your back flat and core tight. Hold, then slide back up.

name: Wall squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart and slightly forward from the wall.
2. Slide your back down the wall into a squat position, thighs roughly parallel to the floor, knees roughly above the heels.
3. Push through your feet to rise back up, keeping your back in contact with the wall.
4. Repeat the lowering and rising motion in a controlled manner for the desired number of reps.
5. Focus on engaging your core and keeping your knees aligned above your feet throughout the movement.
audio_script: Lean your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart and slightly forward. Slide down into a squat, then push back up, keeping knees above your heels and back in contact with the wall. Repeat smoothly for reps.

name: Wall sit with bicep curl
written_instructions:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart and slightly forward.
2. Slide down into a wall sit, thighs roughly parallel to the floor, knees above the heels.
3. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing forward (supinated grip).
4. Perform a bicep curl, bringing the dumbbells toward your shoulders while maintaining the wall sit position.
5. Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner. Repeat for desired reps.
audio_script: Lean your back against a wall and slide down into a squat. Hold dumbbells with palms forward, curl them up to your shoulders, then lower slowly, keeping the wall sit position. Repeat for reps.

name: Goblet squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet about shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell close to your chest with both hands (vertical position).
2. Keep your chest upright and shoulders back.
3. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and hips, keeping your weight evenly distributed across your feet.
4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat.
5. Push through your feet to return to standing. Repeat for desired reps.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell at your chest, stand tall, then lower into a squat. Pause at the bottom, then stand back up. Repeat for reps.

name: Goblet sumo squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointing out, holding a dumbbell vertically close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Squat down by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your weight evenly distributed on your feet.
4. Push through your feet to rise back up to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell close to your chest and stand with feet wide, toes slightly out. Squat down, keeping your chest up and back straight, then rise back up. Repeat.

name: Goblet box squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell vertically close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Sit back onto a box behind you by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your weight evenly distributed on your feet.
4. Stand back up by pushing through your feet to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell close to your chest and stand tall. Sit back onto the box, keeping your chest up and back straight, then push through your feet to stand. Repeat smoothly.

name: Goblet single leg box squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand on one leg while holding a dumbbell vertically close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Slowly sit back onto a box behind you, bending only the standing leg and keeping the other leg extended in front.
4. Stand back up through the standing leg to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch legs.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell close to your chest while standing on one leg. Sit back onto the box, keeping your chest up and back straight, and extend the other leg forward. Push through the standing leg to rise. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch legs.

name: Goblet pistol squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand on one leg while holding a dumbbell vertically close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Slowly lower into a full single-leg squat, extending the other leg forward in front of you.
4. Press through the standing leg to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch legs.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell close to your chest while standing on one leg. Lower into a full squat, extending the other leg forward. Push through the standing leg to rise. Repeat for desired reps, then switch legs.

name: Elevated single leg goblet squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand on a platform or step with one leg, holding a dumbbell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Slowly lower into a single-leg squat, letting the other leg extend forward (you can lightly tap the ground with the heel if needed).
4. Press through the standing leg to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch legs.
audio_script: Stand on a platform on one leg, holding a dumbbell at your chest. Lower into a single-leg squat, letting the other leg extend forward and lightly tap the ground if needed. Push through the standing leg to rise. Repeat and switch legs.

name: Kettlebell goblet squat
variations: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping weight evenly distributed through your feet.
4. Push through your feet to rise back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell at your chest. Squat down, keeping weight evenly through your feet, then push through your feet to rise. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell goblet sumo squat
variations: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing out, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping weight evenly distributed through your feet.
4. Push through your feet to rise back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet wide and toes pointing out, holding a kettlebell at your chest. Squat down, keeping weight evenly through your feet, then push through your feet to rise. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell goblet box squat
variations: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand in front of a sturdy box or bench with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back until you lightly touch the box with your glutes.
4. Push through your feet to rise back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand in front of a box, holding a kettlebell at your chest. Squat down until your glutes lightly touch the box, then push through your feet to rise. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
variations: Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
progression: Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand on one leg in front of a sturdy box or bench, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Slowly lower yourself by bending the standing knee and pushing your hips back until your glutes lightly touch the box.
4. Push through your standing foot to rise back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired reps and switch sides.
audio_script: Stand on one leg holding a kettlebell at your chest. Squat down until your glutes lightly touch the box. Push through your foot to rise. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.

name: Kettlebell goblet pistol squat
variations: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
regression: Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand on one leg, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Extend the non-working leg straight in front of you, keeping it off the ground.
3. Slowly lower yourself by bending the standing knee and pushing your hips back, keeping your chest up and back straight.
4. Go as low as your mobility allows while maintaining balance.
5. Push through the standing foot to return to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.
audio_script: Stand on one leg holding a kettlebell at your chest. Extend your other leg in front of you. Squat down as low as you can while keeping balance, then push through your foot to rise. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.

name: Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
variations: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
regression: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand on a stable elevated surface with one foot, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Extend the non-working leg in front of you.
3. Push your hips back while slowly bending the standing knee, lowering your body with chest up and back straight.
4. At the bottom, the extended leg can lightly tap the ground if needed.
5. Push through the standing foot and drive your hips forward to return to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.
audio_script: Stand on an elevated surface with one foot, holding a kettlebell at your chest. Extend the other leg in front and push your hips back while bending the standing knee. Keep your chest up and back straight. At the bottom, lightly tap the ground with the extended leg if needed, then push through your foot and drive hips forward to rise. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.

name: Front rack kettlebell squats
variations: Front rack kettlebell single leg box squat
Front rack kettlebell elevated single leg goblet squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral.
2. Keep your chest upright and maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees simultaneously to lower into a squat.
4. Lower until your thighs are at least parallel to the ground.
5. Press through your feet to return to standing. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebells resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral. Keep chest upright and spine neutral. Push hips back and bend knees to lower until thighs are at least parallel. Press through your feet to stand back up. Repeat for reps.

name: Front rack kettlebell sumo squat
variations: Front rack kettlebell single leg box squat
Front rack kettlebell elevated single leg goblet squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointing out, holding a kettlebell in each hand resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral.
2. Keep your chest upright and maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees simultaneously to lower into a sumo squat.
4. Lower until your thighs are at least parallel to the ground.
5. Press through your feet to return to standing. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet wide, toes slightly out, kettlebells resting on forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral. Keep chest upright and spine neutral. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a sumo squat until thighs are at least parallel. Press through your feet to stand up. Repeat.

name: Front rack kettlebell box squat
variations: Front rack kettlebell single leg box squat
Front rack kettlebell elevated single leg goblet squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral.
2. Keep your chest upright and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower down toward a box or bench behind you.
4. Lightly tap the box with your glutes.
5. Press through your feet to return to standing. Repeat for desired reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet shoulder-width, kettlebells resting on forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral. Keep chest up and spine neutral. Push hips back and bend knees to lower onto the box, lightly tap with your glutes, then press through your feet to stand. Repeat.

name: Front rack kettlebell single leg box squat
variations: Front rack kettlebell elevated single leg goblet squat
regression: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg slightly extended in front of you, holding a kettlebell in each hand resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral.
2. Keep your chest upright and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Push your hips back and bend the knee of the supporting leg to lower down toward a box or bench behind you.
4. Lightly tap the box with your glutes.
5. Press through the supporting foot to return to standing. Repeat for desired reps, then switch sides.
audio_script: Stand on one leg, kettlebells resting on forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral. Keep chest up and spine neutral. Push hips back and bend the supporting knee to lower onto the box, lightly tap with your glutes, then press through the foot to stand. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.

name: Front rack kettlebell pistol squat
variations: Front rack kettlebell single leg box squat
Front rack kettlebell elevated single leg goblet squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended in front of you, holding a kettlebell in each hand resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral.
2. Keep your chest upright and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Push your hips back and bend the knee of the supporting leg to lower down toward the ground.
4. Lower as far as mobility allows while maintaining balance.
5. Press through the supporting foot to return to standing. Repeat for desired reps, then switch sides.
audio_script: Stand on one leg, kettlebells resting on forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral. Keep chest up. Push hips back and bend the supporting knee to lower down, then press through the foot to stand. Repeat and switch sides.

name: Front rack kettlebell elevated single leg goblet squat
variations: Front rack kettlebell single leg box squat
regression: Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand on one leg on an elevated surface (like a small platform or step), holding two kettlebells in front of your chest, resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral.
2. Keep your chest upright and core engaged.
3. Push your hips back and bend the knee of the supporting leg to lower down toward the ground.
4. Lower as far as mobility allows while optionally lightly tapping your free leg’s heel to the ground.
5. Press through the supporting foot to return to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps, then switch sides.
audio_script: Stand on one leg on a platform, holding two kettlebells on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked. Keep chest up and core tight. Push hips back and bend the supporting knee to lower, lightly tap the other heel if needed, then press through the foot to stand. Repeat and switch sides.

name: Dumbbell squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing your body.
2. Keep your chest upright and core engaged.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a squat.
4. Lower until thighs are roughly parallel to the ground (or as mobility allows), then press through your feet to return to standing.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Keep chest up and core tight. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a squat, then press through your feet to stand. Repeat for reps.

name: Overhead dumbbell squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand overhead with palms facing each other (neutral grip) and arms fully extended.
2. Keep your core tight, chest upright, and gaze forward.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a squat while maintaining the dumbbells overhead.
4. Lower until thighs are roughly parallel to the ground (or as mobility allows), then press through your feet to return to standing.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand overhead with palms facing each other. Keep core tight and chest up. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a squat, keeping the dumbbells overhead. Press through your feet to stand. Repeat for reps.

name: Barbell squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell resting across your upper back (trapezius), hands gripping the bar just outside your shoulders.
2. Keep your chest up, core engaged, and gaze forward.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees, making sure your knees track in line with your toes to prevent caving in.
4. Lower until thighs are roughly parallel to the ground (or as mobility allows), then press through your feet to return to standing.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell resting across your upper back. Keep chest up, core tight, and gaze forward. Push hips back and bend knees, making sure your knees track in line with your toes. Lower until thighs are roughly parallel, then press through your feet to stand. Repeat for reps.

name: Front barbell squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell resting on your front deltoids, close to your throat, elbows lifted and pointing forward, hands gripping the bar just outside your shoulders.
2. Keep your chest up, core tight, and gaze forward.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees, making sure your knees track in line with your toes to prevent caving in.
4. Lower until thighs are roughly parallel to the ground (or as mobility allows), then press through your heels to return to standing.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell resting on your front delts, elbows pointing forward. Keep chest up, core tight, and gaze forward. Push hips back and bend knees, keeping knees in line with your toes. Lower until thighs are roughly parallel, then press through your heels to stand. Repeat for reps.

name: Overhead squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell overhead with arms fully extended, palms facing forward, shoulders active.
2. Keep your chest up, core tight, and gaze forward.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees, ensuring knees track in line with toes to prevent caving in.
4. Lower your body until thighs are roughly parallel to the ground (or as mobility allows), keeping the barbell over mid-foot.
5. Press through your heels and extend hips and knees to return to standing. Repeat for desired reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width, bar overhead with arms extended, shoulders active. Keep chest up, core tight, gaze forward. Push hips back and bend knees, keeping knees in line with toes. Lower until thighs are parallel, keeping the bar over your mid-foot. Press through heels to stand and repeat.

name: Zercher squats
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell in the crook of your elbows (forearms cradling the bar), arms bent, close to your torso.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders back, and core tight.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees, lowering your body down.
4. Lower until your thighs are roughly parallel to the ground, keeping elbows tucked and bar close to your body.
5. Press through your heels to stand, extending hips and knees. Repeat for desired reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet shoulder-width, bar in the crook of your elbows, arms close to torso. Keep chest up, shoulders back, core tight. Push hips back and bend knees, lowering down until thighs are parallel. Press through heels to stand and repeat.

name: Belt squats
written_instructions:
1. Stand on the platform of a belt squat machine with feet shoulder-width apart, and secure the belt around your waist.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders back, and core tight.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees, lowering your body down.
4. Lower until your thighs are roughly parallel to the platform.
5. Press through your heels to stand, extending hips and knees. Repeat for desired reps.
audio_script: Stand on the belt squat platform with feet shoulder-width, belt secured around your waist. Keep chest up and core tight. Push hips back and bend knees, lowering down until thighs are parallel. Press through heels to stand and repeat.

name: Bodyweight bulgarian split squat
variations: Single front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench or elevated surface and place one foot on it behind you.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders back, and core engaged.
3. Push your hips back and bend your front knee, lowering your body until your front thigh is roughly parallel to the ground and the front knee is roughly above the ankle.
4. Keep your weight evenly distributed through your front foot.
5. Press through the front heel to stand and repeat for desired reps, then switch legs.
audio_script: Stand a few feet from a bench with one foot on it behind you. Keep chest up and core tight. Push hips back and bend the front knee, lowering until thigh is parallel and the knee is roughly above the ankle. Keep weight evenly on the front foot. Press through the front heel to stand and repeat, then switch sides.

name: Bodyweight pulse bulgarian split squat
variations: Single front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench or elevated surface and place one foot on it behind you.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders back, and core engaged.
3. Push your hips back and bend your front knee, lowering your body into a deep lunge. Front knee is roughly above the ankle.
4. Instead of rising all the way immediately, lift slightly halfway up, then lower back down, and finally rise fully to the starting position — all this counts as one full repetition.
5. Repeat for desired reps, then switch legs.
audio_script: Stand a few feet from a bench with one foot resting behind you. Keep your chest up and core tight. Bend your front knee and push your hips back to lower into a deep lunge. Lift just halfway up, then lower back down, and finally rise all the way — that’s one rep. Repeat, then switch legs.

name: Single dumbbell bulgarian split squat
variations: Single front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
written_instructions:
1. Hold a dumbbell in the hand on the same side as your front/working leg and stand a couple of feet in front of a bench or elevated surface, placing your other foot on it behind you.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders back, and core engaged.
3. Push your hips back and bend your front knee, lowering your body into a deep lunge. Front knee is roughly above the ankle while keeping your knee aligned with your toes.
4. Rise back up to the starting position.
5. Repeat for desired reps, then switch legs and hold the dumbbell on the same side as the new working leg.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell in the hand on the same side as your front leg. Place your back foot on a bench behind you and keep your chest tall and core tight. Push your hips back and bend your front knee to lower into a deep lunge, keeping your knee in line with your toes, then rise back up to the starting position. Repeat for reps, then switch sides, keeping the dumbbell on the working leg’s side.

name: Single kettlebell bulgarian split squat
variations: Single front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
written_instructions:
1. Hold a kettlebell in the hand on the same side as your front/working leg and stand a couple of feet in front of a bench or elevated surface, placing your other foot on it behind you.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders back, and core engaged.
3. Push your hips back and bend your front knee, lowering your body into a deep lunge while keeping your knee aligned with your toes. front knee is roughly above the ankle.
4. Rise back up to the starting position.
5. Repeat for desired reps, then switch legs and hold the kettlebell on the same side as the new working leg.
audio_script: Hold a kettlebell in the hand on the same side as your front leg. Place your back foot on a bench behind you, keeping your chest tall and core tight. Push your hips back and bend your front knee to lower into a deep lunge, keeping your knee in line with your toes, then rise back up. Repeat for reps, then switch sides, holding the kettlebell on the working leg’s side.

name: Single front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
progression: Double front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
written_instructions:
1. Hold a single kettlebell in a front rack position (resting on your forearm and bicep, elbow tucked, wrist neutral) on the same side as your front/working leg.
2. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench or elevated surface, placing your other foot on it behind you.
3. Keep your chest tall, shoulders back, and core engaged.
4. Push your hips back and bend your front knee, lowering your body into a deep lunge while keeping your knee aligned with your toes. front knee is roughly above the ankle.
5. Rise back up to the starting position, repeat for desired reps, then switch legs and hold the kettlebell on the working leg’s side.
audio_script: Hold a kettlebell in a front rack position on the same side as your front leg. Place your back foot on a bench behind you, keeping chest tall and core tight. Push your hips back and bend your front knee to lower into a deep lunge, keeping your knee aligned with your toes, then rise back up. Repeat for reps, then switch sides, holding the kettlebell on the working leg’s side.

name: Dumbbell bulgarian split squat
variations: Double front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
written_instructions:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, arms at your sides, palms facing your body.
2. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench or elevated surface, placing the top of your back foot on it.
3. Keep your chest tall, shoulders back, and core engaged.
4. Push your hips back and bend your front knee, lowering your body into a deep lunge while keeping the knee aligned with your toes. front knee is roughly above the ankle.
5. Rise back up to the starting position, repeat for desired reps, then switch legs.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Place your back foot on a bench behind you, keeping chest tall and core tight. Push your hips back and bend your front knee to lower into a deep lunge, keeping the knee aligned with your toes, then rise back up. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

name: Kettlebell bulgarian split squat
variations: Double front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench, holding a kettlebell in each hand at your sides.
2. Place the top of one foot on the bench behind you.
3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged.
4. Lower your body by bending the front knee and pushing your hips back, ensuring your front knee stays roughly over the ankle and pointing in the same direction as your toes.
5. Push through the front heel to rise back up to the starting position. Repeat for the desired reps and switch legs.
audio_script: Hold a kettlebell in each hand at your sides. Place one foot behind you on a bench. Lower down by bending the front knee and pushing your hips back, keeping your front knee over the ankle and aligned with your toes. Push through the heel to stand back up. Repeat and switch sides.

name: Double front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
regression: Single front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench, holding a kettlebell in each hand in a front rack position (resting on forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral).
2. Place the top of one foot on the bench behind you.
3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged.
4. Lower your body by bending the front knee and pushing your hips back, ensuring your front knee stays roughly over the ankle and points in the same direction as your toes.
5. Push through the front heel to rise back up to the starting position. Repeat for the desired reps and switch legs.
audio_script: Hold a kettlebell in each hand in the front rack position—resting the bells on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral. Place one foot on a bench behind you. Lower down by bending the front knee and pushing your hips back, keeping the front knee over the ankle and aligned with your toes. Push through the heel to stand back up. Repeat and switch sides.

name: Goblet bulgarian split squat
variations: Double front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench, holding a dumbbell close to your chest in a goblet position.
2. Place the top of one foot on the bench behind you.
3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged.
4. Lower your body by bending the front knee and pushing your hips back, ensuring your front knee stays roughly over the ankle and points in the same direction as your toes.
5. Push through the front heel to rise back up to the starting position. Repeat for the desired reps and switch legs.

Lower down by bending the front knee and pushing your hips back, keeping the front knee over the ankle and aligned with your toes. Push through the heel to stand back up. Repeat and switch sides.

name: Kettlebell goblet bulgarian split squat
variations: Double front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench, holding a kettlebell close to your chest in a goblet position.
2. Place the top of one foot on the bench behind you.
3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged.
4. Lower your body by bending the front knee and pushing your hips back, ensuring your front knee stays roughly over the ankle and points in the same direction as your toes.
5. Push through the front heel to rise back up to the starting position. Repeat for the desired reps and switch legs.
audio_script: Hold a kettlebell close to your chest in the goblet position. Place one foot on a bench behind you. Lower down by bending the front knee and pushing your hips back, keeping the front knee over the ankle and aligned with your toes. Push through the heel to stand back up. Repeat and switch sides.

name: Barbell bulgarian split squat
variations: Double front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench, resting a barbell across your upper back (trapezius), keeping your chest upright and core tight.
2. Place the top of one foot on the bench behind you.
3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged.
4. Lower your body by bending the front knee and pushing your hips back, making sure your front knee stays roughly over the ankle and points in the same direction as your toes.
5. Push through the front heel to rise back up to the starting position. Repeat for the desired reps and switch legs.
audio_script: Rest a barbell across your upper back. Place one foot on a bench behind you. Lower down by bending the front knee and pushing your hips back, keeping the front knee over the ankle and aligned with your toes. Push through the heel to stand back up. Repeat and switch sides.

name: Front barbell bulgarian split squat
variations: Double front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench, holding a barbell across the front of your shoulders in a front rack position: elbows up and forward, bar resting on your front delts, wrists neutral, hands gripping the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Place the top of one foot on the bench behind you.
3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged.
4. Lower your body by bending the front knee and pushing your hips back, making sure your front knee stays roughly over the ankle and points in the same direction as your toes.
5. Push through the front heel to rise back up to the starting position. Repeat for the desired reps and switch legs.
audio_script: Hold a barbell in a front rack position on your shoulders: elbows up, hands gripping slightly wider than shoulder-width, wrists neutral. Place one foot on a bench behind you. Lower down by bending the front knee and pushing your hips back, keeping the front knee over the ankle and aligned with your toes. Push through the heel to stand back up. Repeat and switch sides.

name: Bodyweight walking lunges
variations: Double front rack kettlebell walking lunges
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart, arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step forward with one leg, landing heel first.
3. Bend both knees to lower your body until the front thigh is roughly parallel to the ground and the back knee hovers just above the floor.
4. Ensure the front knee stays roughly over the ankle and points in the same direction as your toes.
5. Push through the front foot to step forward, bringing the back leg forward to continue walking lunges. Repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart. Step forward with one leg, bend both knees until the front thigh is parallel and knee over ankle. Step forward with the back leg to continue walking lunges. Repeat for reps.

name: Bodyweight pulse walking lunges
variations: Double front rack kettlebell walking lunges
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart, arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step forward with one leg, landing heel first.
3. Bend both knees to lower your body until the front thigh is roughly parallel to the ground and the back knee hovers just above the floor.
4. Perform a small “pulse”: rise halfway up, then lower back down, and finally rise fully to complete one rep.
5. Continue stepping forward with the other leg and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart. Step forward with one leg, bend both knees until the front thigh is parallel. Pulse by rising halfway, lowering back down, then rising fully — that counts as one rep. Step forward with the other leg and continue for reps.

name: Dumbbell walking lunges
variations: Double front rack kettlebell walking lunges
written_instructions:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing your body.
2. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Step forward with one leg, landing heel first.
4. Bend both knees to lower your body until the front thigh is roughly parallel to the ground and the back knee hovers just above the floor. Keep the front knee roughly over the ankle and pointing in the same direction as your toes.
5. Push through the front foot to step forward, bringing the back leg forward to continue walking lunges. Repeat for desired reps.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Step forward with one leg, bend both knees until the front thigh is parallel and knee over ankle. Step forward with the back leg to continue walking lunges. Repeat for reps or distance.

name: Kettlebell walking lunges
variations: Double front rack kettlebell walking lunges
written_instructions:
1. Hold a kettlebell in each hand at your sides, palms facing your body.
2. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Step forward with one leg, landing heel first.
4. Bend both knees to lower your body until the front thigh is roughly parallel to the ground and the back knee hovers just above the floor. Keep the front knee roughly over the ankle and pointing in the same direction as your toes.
5. Push through the front foot to step forward, bringing the back leg forward to continue the walking lunges. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Hold a kettlebell in each hand at your sides. Step forward and bend both knees until the front thigh is parallel and knee over ankle. Step forward with the back leg to continue alternating lunges. Repeat for reps.

2. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart.

audio_script: Hold a dumbbell close to your chest in a goblet position. Step forward and bend both knees until the front thigh is parallel and knee over ankle. Step forward with the back leg to continue alternating lunges. Repeat for reps.

Step forward and bend both knees until the front thigh is parallel and knee over ankle. Step forward with the back leg to continue alternating walking lunges. Repeat for reps.

5. Push through the front foot to step forward, bringing the back leg forward to continue the alternating walking lunge. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Rest a barbell across your upper back. Step forward and bend both knees until the front thigh is parallel and knee over ankle. Step forward with the back leg to continue alternating walking lunges. Repeat for reps.

name: Front barbell walking lunges

Step forward and bend both knees until the front thigh is parallel and knee over ankle. Step forward with the back leg to continue alternating walking lunges. Repeat for reps.

5. Repeat with the other leg, alternating legs for the desired number of reps.

written_instructions:

2. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Step forward with one leg, landing heel first.
4. Bend both knees to lower your body until the front thigh is roughly parallel to the ground and the back knee hovers just above the floor. Keep the front knee roughly over the ankle and pointing in the same direction as your toes.
5. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps, alternating legs.

name: Jumping lunge
variations: Bodyweight reverse lunges with rear leg raise
Dumbbell reverse lunges with rear leg raise
Double front rack kettlebell reverse lunges
Single arm front rack kettlebell reverse lunges
Alternating reverse lunges with bicep curls
written_instructions:
1. Start in a split stance with one foot forward and one foot back, arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Bend both knees slightly and prepare to jump.
3. Jump explosively, switching your legs in mid-air so the opposite foot lands forward.
4. Land softly with knees slightly bent to absorb impact, keeping the front knee roughly over the ankle and pointing in the same direction as your toes.
5. Immediately repeat, continuing to alternate legs for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Start in a split stance. Bend both knees slightly and jump explosively, switching your legs in mid-air. Land softly with knees bent, keeping the front knee over the ankle. Repeat, alternating legs for reps.

name: Bodyweight reverse lunges with rear leg raise

Single arm front rack kettlebell reverse lunges
Alternating reverse lunges with bicep curls
progression: Dumbbell reverse lunges with rear leg raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart, arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step backward with one leg, lowering into a reverse lunge so the front leg’s thigh is roughly parallel to the ground.
3. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position while simultaneously lifting the front leg forward so the thigh is parallel to the ground and the knee bent at 90 degrees (like a high knee).
4. Lower the lifted leg back under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on the working leg before switching sides.

name: Alternating bodyweight pulse reverse lunges

Dumbbell reverse lunges with rear leg raise
Double front rack kettlebell reverse lunges
Single arm front rack kettlebell reverse lunges
Alternating reverse lunges with bicep curls
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart, arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step backward with one leg, lowering into a reverse lunge so the front leg’s thigh is roughly parallel to the ground.
3. Perform a “pulse”: rise halfway up, then lower all the way down, and finally rise fully to the starting position — this counts as one repetition.
4. Step backward with the other leg and repeat the same pulsing motion.
5. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart. Step backward into a lunge, keeping the front thigh parallel and knee over ankle. Pulse by rising halfway, lowering back down, then rising fully — that’s one rep. Step backward with the other leg and repeat. Continue alternating for reps.

4. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position.

name: Glute bridge
variations: Single leg glute bridge with abduction
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Arms should rest at your sides.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. Hold the top position for a moment, squeezing your glutes.
5. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor and repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Engage your core and glutes, then press through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees. Hold, squeeze, and lower back down. Repeat for reps.

2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through the heel of the bent leg to lift your hips toward the ceiling, forming a straight line from shoulders to extended foot.
4. Hold the top position for a moment, squeezing your glutes.
5. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor and repeat for the desired number of reps on that leg before switching sides.
audio_script: Lie on your back with one foot flat and the other leg extended. Engage your core and glutes, then press through the bent leg to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to the extended foot. Hold, squeeze, and lower back down. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

name: Glute bridge with abduction
variations: Single leg glute bridge with abduction
written_instructions:
1. Place a mini loop band just above your knees. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Arms should rest at your sides.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. At the top, push your knees outward against the band to perform hip abduction, then return knees to hip-width distance.
5. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor and repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Place a mini loop band just above your knees. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Engage your core and glutes, lift your hips to form a straight line from shoulders to knees, and push your knees outward against the band. Lower back down and repeat for reps.

4. At the top, push the extended leg outward against the band to perform hip abduction, then return the leg to its starting position.

2. Place your hands on your hips or lightly behind your neck, whichever feels comfortable.
3. Engage your core and glutes.
4. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, keeping your knees roughly above your ankles.
5. Slowly lower your hips back down and repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: Elevated hip thrusts tricep extension

2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. While holding the top position, bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells toward your forehead (like a neutral-grip skull crusher), then extend your arms back to the starting position.
5. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor and repeat the hip thrust and tricep extension sequence for the desired number of reps.
